663486943.name: Teen and toddler
663486943.author: a TripAdvisor user
663486943.reviewBody:
Don’t need a tour for this one. 
Bought of my daughters liked it. The teen one took beautiful photos and the toddler had a blast at las grutas and bridges. Nice place
Tips: go on weekdays 
No stroller friendly

Fee: 20 pesos for the park
10 pesos for las grutas (totally worth it)
Parking: free
Restroom: 5 pesos. 
Food: you can buy food there. 
You can spend the night there if you like. But I think 2-3 hrs are enough. 
If you are around, don’t hesitate on going.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

649572152.name: Lovely, relaxed day out to this beautiful ecotourism park
649572152.author: a TripAdvisor user
649572152.reviewBody: We caught a Colectivo from the central market for 15 pesos each & took approx 20/25 mins to get out to the park. Yes you pay to get in but 10 pesos towards maintenance & upkeep, doesn\u2019t exactly break the Bank!. We had a lovely, relaxed day wandering around, across the river, up into the Grutas. Only negative comment would be that it\u2019s not very well sign posted once inside the Park but if you want a quiet, relaxed time out of San Crist\u00f3bal, go & see the Park.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

649571594.name: Beautiful, relaxing place to walk and enjoy nature.
649571594.author: a TripAdvisor user
649571594.reviewBody: No need to take a tour - just take a collectivo from the street behind the local market for15 pesos!  It\'s a short trip and an easy walk into the reserve if your collectivo doesn\'t go right there.  Beautiful river, forest, snacks and drinks available. Entry fee is 10 pesos, plus 15 pesos if you want to go through the \'grutas\', caves high up in the cliffs with amazing rock formations. There are some ziplines over the forest and river. There\'s also a boat trip, but we didn\'t see it so I don\'t know where it goes. A lovely, peaceful place to spend a few hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

593413066.name: Don\'t miss las grutas
593413066.author: a TripAdvisor user
593413066.reviewBody: The stroll through the park and alongside the river is picturesque and serene.  But the real fun is exploring the caves, which are small but go on further than we expected with plenty of fun hidden nooks and crannies.  Entry to the park is 10 pesos, and the caves are another 15 pesos, and the combined price of 25 pesos is cheap -- much cheaper than some other attractions that we enjoyed less.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

586690388.name: Rocky castle over the river
586690388.author: a TripAdvisor user
586690388.reviewBody: The Arcotete is park featuring a natural limestone arch over the Fogotico River, close to San Cristobal. In the last decade or so, a narrow pathway with cement steps has made it possible for travellers to climb up to the intricate little caves and passageways, full of stalactites and stalagmites, with a view of the river itself directly below. This is a spectacular and dizzying experience! You can also take the path down from the parking lot to the edge of the river and admire the rock formations from below, or wave to your friends up above. Wide fields cropped by sheep are great for playing soccer, there are cabins and swings, a hanging bridge and paths through the woods and along the riverside. The local indigenous people manage the place and have a restaurant by the parking lot with good quesadillas and other local snacks and dishes.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

563592649.name: Boring
563592649.author: a TripAdvisor user
563592649.reviewBody: Not worth a visit. You must pay to get in. It\'s boring. The town is much better to walk around and you must get a taxi here

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

553353821.name: Respite into nature
553353821.author: a TripAdvisor user
553353821.reviewBody: Arcotete was an easy short ride to get to (don\'t pay more than 100 pesos for a taxi). We hiked around the park, and took advantage of the walk along the river and climb into the rock face. It was a quiet and green experience and a way of getting to know the native plant life. Plan on taking a couple of hours to explore.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

543909778.name: Fun Little Spot!
543909778.author: a TripAdvisor user
543909778.reviewBody: This is a small park but worth an hour of your time if you\'re in the area. The cave was fun to explore and I was able to take some nice pictures of it. \n\nI took a colectivo to the site for 7 pesos but then decided to take a taxi to another park across town. The transportation options at the park are limited, but I was able to use my Spanish to haggle with the cab driver to lower the crazy fare he was asking for.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

529455950.name: great place to explore the natural environment
529455950.author: a TripAdvisor user
529455950.reviewBody: this place is perfect for families and friends to come and visit a slice of the chiapaz highland natural environment. with so many trails and areas to just relax, a cave, a river with a natural arch and a zip line, all one could want.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

505305543.name: Nice place just outside San Chirstobal
505305543.author: a TripAdvisor user
505305543.reviewBody: Quiet place for hiking with a nice cave. We did the ziplines (tiroleresa), which were very cool! Entrance fee is only 10 pesos pp, caves 10 pesos pp and ziplines only 100 pesos pp for two lines. Worth the visit for a few hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

499797376.name: Fun
499797376.author: a TripAdvisor user
499797376.reviewBody: Nice place with great views. Sort of a hiking experience. There is a zip lines, a river and a cave. Wear comfortable shoes.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

488262685.name: Hike bring picnic lunch
488262685.author: a TripAdvisor user
488262685.reviewBody:
Great place to be in nature. Don't follow the signs, instead follow google maps. 

We went with young kids and hiked/explored for a couple hours. 

Be warned the grutas close at 5.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

465100523.name: Great spot during the week
465100523.author: a TripAdvisor user
465100523.reviewBody: Great spot during the week.  Gets a bit crowded on weekends, but not terribly.  We camped for a couple of nights.  No showers, but flush toilets.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

450177763.name: Nature Walk and Picnic close to San Cristobal
450177763.author: a TripAdvisor user
450177763.reviewBody: Arcotete is a great place for an afternoon getaway into nature. Just a short taxi ride from San Cristobal, it\'s a small haven for a picnic or hike. you\'ll find a small concession stand and picnic area outside the main park. You take take trails that are easy to moderate hikes across the stream that meanders through the cave that cuts through the mountain. You can also hike to the top of the cave for a vista point. It\'s a nice way to spend the afternoon relaxing in the quiet.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

449034642.name: Small Hidden Rock Climbing Haven
449034642.author: a TripAdvisor user
449034642.reviewBody: A group of friends and I went here for climbing. It was a nice ecopark with lots of climbing potential. We met a guy from Vertigo Rock Climbing as he just finished a new route in the cave. There\u00b4s a few routes in the cave and along a trail. Hopefully many more to come!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

439540680.name: Great getaway for a picnic.
439540680.author: a TripAdvisor user
439540680.reviewBody: Good and close day getaway from San Cristobal. Pick up your own drinks and food and head out for a good afternoon bbq. You can even arrange a taxi to drop you off and pick you up if you do not have a ride.  Bring carbon for the bbq and remember what season you are in, just in case it rains later on in the day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

407731506.name: Nice walk.  Nothing spectacular.
407731506.author: a TripAdvisor user
407731506.reviewBody: A great place to be among the nature and escape from San Crist\u00f3bal town.  But nothing really spectacular.  It is not worth going there I think unless you live in San Crist\u00f3bal and want to spend a picnic day with your friends or family.  Do not lose your time there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

398035834.name: Great splash of nature outside of the city
398035834.author: a TripAdvisor user
398035834.reviewBody: We were in San Cris for 2 weeks and our country kids loved the chance to get out into nature.  The caves are awesome, there are great trails to walk and swings for the kids.  You can zip-line or take a paddle down the river.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

372546061.name: Nature in Chiapas
372546061.author: a TripAdvisor user
372546061.reviewBody: It\'s close to San Crist\u00f3bal de las Casas. I arranged a bike tour and passed El Arcotete, where I walked with a guide. It is not so spectacular as other nature spots in Chiapas, but the short distance to the city allows you to have a short impression of what this Mexican state has to offer in terms of nature. Don\'t go when it rains, then it\'s too muddy.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

372136481.name: Nice climbing routes
372136481.author: a TripAdvisor user
372136481.reviewBody: I went to "El Arcotete" with a local guy, who invited me to rock climb. The routes where very good fun! challenging but doable. I was surprised with the facilities, as this people have created a really nice area, which remains clean and tidy... i recomend it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

371008049.name: Nice walk!! Dont do a tour!!
371008049.author: a TripAdvisor user
371008049.reviewBody: Walking around the area was lovely, really enjoyed it. \n\nHowever we paid 500 Pasos for basically a lift to and from. When we realised where it was we could have walked from out hostel. So get a cab or walk!! Didnt do the caving but enjoyed the scenery.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

369370343.name: Close to San Cristobal, 100 peso taxi ride.
369370343.author: a TripAdvisor user
369370343.reviewBody: Great walking trails along a river in a pine forest. Large caves with interesting overlooks.  Not scairy at all. Nice picnic areas and tire swings for kids.  Take a blanket and a picnic lunch.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

364999654.name: Unique cave experience, good exercise, nice temperature
364999654.author: a TripAdvisor user
364999654.reviewBody: When we were there, a group of indigenous people from an evangelical church were there in full traditional garments making a DVD, so we got a bonus culture experience. The scenery was pleasant along the river and there were some intermediate climbs that even we plump elderly people were able to do.  The cave with the open areas where you could look out onto the river you\'d just walked past was more fun than we had imagined -- a cave with \'windows.\'   We got locked inside the cave at closing time because the employees failed to pay attention that we had not come out yet and did not check carefully to make sure the cave was empty.  Several anxious moments thinking we would spend the night in the cave.  Our friends who had chosen not to go in the cave were able to find someone at the entrance to re-open the  cave, so it turned into a great travel story -- but would not have been much fun if we\'d had to spend the night there.  If you enter the cave in the late afternoon, do something to make sure the ticket-seller doesn\'t leave before you come out, or leave one member outside the cave who is focused on what\'s going on. [One of our friends was intently involved with her cell phone and the other was walking around elsewhere, and didn\'t notice that the employee was leaving.]

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

360162509.name: Yo!
360162509.author: a TripAdvisor user
360162509.reviewBody: Your map location is way off..   It\'s a small area, you pay 10 pecos when you get there & 10 pecos to use tha pathway up top..

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

347094592.name: Very Impressed.  Worth Visit.
347094592.author: a TripAdvisor user
347094592.reviewBody: More than expected and well worth price.  10 pesos admittance to beautiful park with lots of trails to and along river and to overlooks.  10 pesos for cave.  Small, but very interesting.  Small, but felt adventurous, and not hard to navigate.  For more pesos zip line, rappel, individual palapa picnic shelters.  Only 20 minutes from San Cristobal.  If map program shows you 35 minute route east of town, just follow it to sign that says "Arcoteta" which is the entrance.  Clean ba\u00f1os (no toilet paper) and small snack shop.  I was told weekends were busy, but very few people during week.  Peaceful.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

335309714.name: Not too far from San Cristobal
335309714.author: a TripAdvisor user
335309714.reviewBody: For 10 pesos you can climb through this section of a cave that is quasi-open-air and looks out over the river that cut open the cave. There is ziplining nearby (we didn\'t do it, but the zipline looked long and quite scenic). There is also some nice parks and rocks on which to sit for a nice lunch.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

324769116.name: AMAZING!!!!
324769116.author: a TripAdvisor user
324769116.reviewBody: I can\'t understand why this place is so empty and forgotten! It is just MARBELOUS! A river cut half a mountain forming a series of caves and caverns that are just beautiful! I came here with a biking tour and eventhough it was EXHAUSTING to arrive from San Cristobal (must of it it\'s super steep ways) it is totally worth it! They charge you 10 pesos to entere to the park and 10 more for the key to the groutes! If you love off of the beaten path attractions and you are into nature this is the place for you! Totally worth it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

320812323.name: Beautiful place
320812323.author: a TripAdvisor user
320812323.reviewBody: Great place to explore and relax. The rock formations inside the cave are Beautiful. The river cold but very nice too.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

287407995.name: Fun view.
287407995.author: a TripAdvisor user
287407995.reviewBody: Good place to visit and have a picnic outside the cavern.  Nothing special in specific. Looks very similar to other caverns.  But if you like nature like we do, you will defenately enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

260755548.name: Nice place for barbecues near San Cristobal
260755548.author: a TripAdvisor user
260755548.reviewBody: El Arcotete ir about 15-20 minutes away from San Crist\u00f3bal by car.\nIt\u00b4s a nice place for barbecues with friends or family, but nothing else. I think there is a small river or some atraction, but we didn\u00b4t visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

242995125.name: Very nice place for a short visit
242995125.author: a TripAdvisor user
242995125.reviewBody: This place is really nice. You can easily walk through the whole caves with espectacular views. Im not very intrepid and managed to get across. It is a short visit from San Cristobal

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

241492249.name: Wonderful Place
241492249.author: a TripAdvisor user
241492249.reviewBody: How cool is that! It\'s 20min out of San Cristobal de las Casas. And you are in a different world.\nHiked from the entrance down to San Cris, next to the river. It was really adventurous and fun.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

196804858.name: Beautiful
196804858.author: a TripAdvisor user
196804858.reviewBody: I liked everything about this site. The cueva is well kept, the tirolesa is great, the rappel as well (I didn\'t do it, but someone told me they had loved it). This is a great place to go to and spend a few hours

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

195018135.name: Grottos,Hanging Bridges, Wandering Sheep
195018135.author: a TripAdvisor user
195018135.reviewBody: This is a natural  park a few minutes outside of San Cristobal, perhaps a five minute taxi ride. There are trails, with high rock grottos, easily climbed. It is a natural miracle with a small river running through a rock arch.. Locals freely run their sheep through meadows and students play on the hanging bridge. There is parking, food and washrooms. It is a quiet gem of a place and worth a visit. Entrance is about 20 pesos and includes the trails to the rock arch.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Tenejapa

662537781.name: Gorgeous!
662537781.author: a TripAdvisor user
662537781.reviewBody: This is the best possible place for anyone interested in some of the most beautiful local textiles, both new and antique, in an extremely attractive and cool and pleasant setting. It\'s also a welcome break from the hustle and bustle outside and has a little shop with extremely high quality, but not very cheap, items.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

658245811.name: Wonderful museum
658245811.author: a TripAdvisor user
658245811.reviewBody: This is an incredible museum. A collection of local ethnic groups\' textiles covering Chiapas and into Central America. Besides the clothes on display yoiu can also open dozens of trays with other clothes. This was a real treat.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

654149115.name: Great collections
654149115.author: a TripAdvisor user
654149115.reviewBody: It\u2019s a nice place to see different textile. They have a nice collection of all this region. But it would be better with more introduction and background info.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

649572481.name: a great collection
649572481.author: a TripAdvisor user
649572481.reviewBody: For anyone interested in the textiles of the area....an amazing comprehensive collection for distinct areas , well worth the visit

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

648600310.name: Comprehensive Collection of Mayan Textiles
648600310.author: a TripAdvisor user
648600310.reviewBody: We spent several hours in this remarkable museum, enjoying what is possibly the finest and most comprehensive collection of Mayan textiles in the world.  Textiles are beautifully displayed by region and below each regional example are drawers housing additional textiles from each area.  The probably is the most important museum in San Cristobal and should not be missed.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

648235403.name: Great place to visit if you are interested in textles
648235403.author: a TripAdvisor user
648235403.reviewBody: Beautiful, modern displays of Chiapan textiles with English explanations. Many examples of huiples, most from the \'70\'s on.  There is a beautiful display of clothes on mannequins with drawers of others beneath.  They are doing a great job of preserving this aspect of the culture;

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

633622879.name: Worthwhile visiting!
633622879.author: a TripAdvisor user
633622879.reviewBody: Some really nice examples of older (mid-20th C) Mayan clothing and a sweet little interactive (computer area) zone, seemingly designed for young kids that was fun to navigate (all in Spanish, though...but as it\'s designed for kids, it\'s a great Spanish "helper" for your language skills if you have the basics). There is also a gallery there with installations from contemporary textile artists that is lovely. All of this in the ex-convent of Santo Domingo, which has undergone a lot of restoration work to accommodate this centro.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

633509558.name: A Feast for Textiles\' Lovers
633509558.author: a TripAdvisor user
633509558.reviewBody: Beautifully organized and displayed exhibition of the various textiles made by - and worn - by the various Maya ethnic groups of Chiapas & Guatemala.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

630296690.name: Cool museum
630296690.author: a TripAdvisor user
630296690.reviewBody:
For our anniversary earlier this year my husband and I went to a few places in Mexico. One of them was San Cristobal de las Casas. Our travel agency recommended we visit the Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya, so we did, walking there from our hotel. 

The beginning on the museum actually had artifacts from the region that weren't textiles at all, but they were interesting. Upstairs was the main museum. There were beautiful handmade blankets, clothing, and more. The items were very colorful and had so much detail. They must have taken a long time to make. 

Outside the museum was a vendor area where many tents were set up and people were selling things. We did not really check these out.

The pieces are from Mexico and Central America and there were many items to look at. There was a video but most of the museum has very little English, but just looking at the items doesn't need a language to see how much work went into their creation.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

615401207.name: High quality with intentions to preserve ancient skills.
615401207.author: a TripAdvisor user
615401207.reviewBody: Great to see the high end weaving, but too pricey for casual shopping. However, worth spending to get the top quality and appreciate the weavers\' skills.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

605448132.name: Last minute visit
605448132.author: a TripAdvisor user
605448132.reviewBody: Would have loved to stay a longer time, we came just barely before closing time and we kinda had to run, but the textiles woow impresive af.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

597130156.name: I can\'t believe these things are made by hand !!!
597130156.author: a TripAdvisor user
597130156.reviewBody: Lots of colorful textiles made by the local population. These are some of the nicest weaves and embroidery that I\'ve ever seen. The samples are in glass covered  drawers that you can pull out while a light turns on automatically. You can see all the hand made detail in vibrant colors !!! Amazing how all this is done without any sort of machinery. If you are into fashions and design then this is the museum for you !!!  Down stairs there is also a colonial art section which is top notch, indeed. It shows the early history of Chiapas, an amalgamation of two amazing cultures. There is even a gift shop where you can buy, if you have cash, some of these amazing textiles !!!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

594358258.name: Amazing art on textiles!
594358258.author: a TripAdvisor user
594358258.reviewBody: Only when you say the amazing work and the countless hours Chiapanecas put into their work, you understand the price for a well done textile you buy there.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

590608582.name: worth it!
590608582.author: a TripAdvisor user
590608582.reviewBody: This museum is a must in San Cristobal. Both, the building and the collection are beautiful. If you are interested in knowing about dressing and fashion of the people of the highlands you have to visit it. Be prepared to spend at least two or three hours.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

590258566.name: Very interesting - I could have spent hours here!
590258566.author: a TripAdvisor user
590258566.reviewBody: The museum is larger than I thought it would be. The building is beautiful! I loved learning all about the textiles and techniques used by different Mayan groups. They have many gorgeous items in the gift shop and (at least the day I visited) there was a nice artisans market nearby that was fun to shop in!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

589589951.name: The Best
589589951.author: a TripAdvisor user
589589951.reviewBody: They have a collection of the best of the region. Staff is part of the "coperativa" and are well informed. A must visit. They take CC cards !

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

588797558.name: superb museum
588797558.author: a TripAdvisor user
588797558.reviewBody: a must for anyone interested in textile design in beautifully designed modern areas laid out in an old convent

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

586780985.name: Short but Substantive!
586780985.author: a TripAdvisor user
586780985.reviewBody: This was great. Take an hour or two in the upstairs textile museum, and look through the hundreds of drawers with textilex underneath the display windows.  The downstairs is a bit of a bust, with the usual Spanish artefacts, religious objects, etc.  Yawn!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

579526235.name: Beautiful textiles.
579526235.author: a TripAdvisor user
579526235.reviewBody: You get a real appreciation for the interesting styles of dressing in the different regions. Well worth a visit and open the drawers to see even more treasures.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

578545373.name: Textile Treasures
578545373.author: a TripAdvisor user
578545373.reviewBody: This small museum in a renovated nunnery is well done and the artistry of the indigenous people of the entire central American countries are showcased.  Nicely done. About an hour\'s worth.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

578509237.name: Interesting exhibit, and great textiles for sale
578509237.author: a TripAdvisor user
578509237.reviewBody: The upstairs exhibit space has several interesting rooms in which you can see different traditional textiles and clothes.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

575628405.name: Must see!
575628405.author: a TripAdvisor user
575628405.reviewBody: Very important museum.  Relatively small but prepare to linger and open all the drawers in the main gallery.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

575480996.name: Very boring and not much to see
575480996.author: a TripAdvisor user
575480996.reviewBody: I paid 60 pesos to get in here and I was very disappointed. There really wasn\u2019t much to see. If you are really into your textiles I\u2019m sure you will enjoy it though.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

575053958.name: Beautiful works of art!
575053958.author: a TripAdvisor user
575053958.reviewBody: The museum is small but the textiles and clothes on display are absolute works of art! You can easily spend a couple of hours just admiring many of the pieces in the collection and marveling at intricate weaves. This small museum is located on the second floor in the former convent section of the Santo Domingo church. The first floor also has a small museum featuring religious objects from the town\'s 400 year history.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

574437094.name: Must see.
574437094.author: a TripAdvisor user
574437094.reviewBody: Must see if you want to understand more of the people you meet on the street, understand how they dress and value what you see/buy locally. Very professional setup in a beautiful renovated building.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

572507562.name: Very poor.... 60 pesos to enter
572507562.author: a TripAdvisor user
572507562.reviewBody: The part of the fabrics is very small. There were no demonstrations at all. The films are too short and uninteresting. The place that seemed to me the most interesting was closed. Really do not recommend coming to this museum.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

569379641.name: Wonderful collection
569379641.author: a TripAdvisor user
569379641.reviewBody: The displays here are beautifully presented and give a great insight into the textile history of the Maya - the art of the women. They are in a restored seminary attached to the church of Santo Domingo so it is very atmospheric. the religious museum downstairs is interesting too but info only in Spanish

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

568625764.name: Excellent collection of textiles
568625764.author: a TripAdvisor user
568625764.reviewBody: Great collection of modern textiles and there is also a shop where you can but exquisite work by the indigenous artisans. Highly recommend.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

567136462.name: Amazing collection of textiles and information about them
567136462.author: a TripAdvisor user
567136462.reviewBody: If you like textiles and are interested in the different villages and their own distinct weavings, this place is worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

564781047.name: If you love clothes/costumes check it out
564781047.author: a TripAdvisor user
564781047.reviewBody: It may not be the most exciting museum, but you will see some of Chiapas\' most beautiful cultural dresses in a really beautiful space

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

558320052.name: Very interesting
558320052.author: a TripAdvisor user
558320052.reviewBody: This is a great collection of textiles from Chiapas and Guatemala. Some are displayed in glass cases but there are also drawers you can pull out to view more of the collection. You can spend hours in there.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

558178761.name: The best museum in town
558178761.author: a TripAdvisor user
558178761.reviewBody:
I was extremely impress with the collection and the gorgeous facility. 

Check museum hours as many places close on certain days and hours.

Loved everything about this museum, the quality of Art and textiles display are perfection. 

If you are looking for good finds ( affordable gifts) the market outside this museum has everything. 
A must see before you leave town.

Happy Travels !

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

552550193.name: Beautifully curated collections
552550193.author: a TripAdvisor user
552550193.reviewBody: Highly recommend this lovely place with good lighting, great collection, and excellent experience.  Good 10 minute video showing how the textiles are made start to finish.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

544408677.name: outstanding
544408677.author: a TripAdvisor user
544408677.reviewBody: the finest textiles in the region all in one store!!...Napkins, tablecloths...clothing, pillows...Very high quality with prices to match...If you want the best it is more but worth it to me..

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

541025469.name: Essential visit for all interested in Mayan textiles
541025469.author: a TripAdvisor user
541025469.reviewBody: This museum is a real jewel of cultural and artistic history. There are amazing examples of weaving and embroidery from throughout the Mayan world, along with very well-produced video presentations about the history, culture and techniques of the art.  The 55 peso entrance fee is a real bargain. The associated store is worth a visit in its own right, offering a variety of very high quality textiles produced by a cooperative of expert Chiapas weavers.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

525541336.name: Closed for quake repair Sept 2017
525541336.author: a TripAdvisor user
525541336.reviewBody: This and next door Santo Domingo cathedral are closed as of Sept 7, 2017, a guard said museo might open in a few more weeks, the cathedral in a couple of months, but who knows.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

517998529.name: Great for textile and history lovers
517998529.author: a TripAdvisor user
517998529.reviewBody: The place really does have a strong collection of textiles and fabrics. When we arrived there was an art class taking place on the ground floor outside the building which was interesting to watch. \n\nNote that that textiles museum is upstairs and you are required to pay $55 MXN per person to enter.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

510283236.name: Beautiful building very well maintained
510283236.author: a TripAdvisor user
510283236.reviewBody: The exhibitions are nice, but the best part is the building. Huge thick walls, colonial style rooms.. The maintenance is great so you can enjoy the place. 30-45 minutes and great place to take photos in.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

504457307.name: Better than I expected
504457307.author: a TripAdvisor user
504457307.reviewBody: The museum provided me with a really nice introduction into the arts and crafts of Chiapas and Guatemala - with an interesting section on the changes in patterns throughout the decades. There is also a small historical section, but unfortunately it\'s only in Spanish.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

500812585.name: world class
500812585.author: a TripAdvisor user
500812585.reviewBody: the textiles and information in this museum is world class. get close and see the art of the weavers of chiapas and the maya world.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

498710390.name: World class museum, a must if interested in Chiapas textiles and history
498710390.author: a TripAdvisor user
498710390.reviewBody: I lived in San Cris for 2 years back in the early 90\'s and there was nothing like this museum back then. As Mexican I\'m really proud of the work the Fomento Cultural Banamex has done to preserve such a great and old tradition. Chiapas textiles are quite interesting as they interweave old Mayan traditions with Colonial history and best represent the diversity of the different communities in the area. Quite colorful and intricate designs. A feast to the eyes. I\'m very impressed by the quality of the exhibits and the settings. To me the 2nd floor is what\'s most important and unique of the museum collection. You won\'t find such an extensive collection anywhere else. Worth the stop.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

491388055.name: Gorgeous Collection!
491388055.author: a TripAdvisor user
491388055.reviewBody: Fantastic place to understand one of the most important artisanal industries of this part of Mexico.  Not to be missed.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

489496591.name: Gorgeous fabrics
489496591.author: a TripAdvisor user
489496591.reviewBody: A wonderful collection of textiles and to be able to see the quality of the artisans who have produced them in such a great building is a must experience in San Cristobal

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

487770242.name: Stellar collection of art in restored convent
487770242.author: a TripAdvisor user
487770242.reviewBody: The Dominicans ruled the roost in Chiapas during the colonial period and Sto. Domingo in San Cristobal was its main church, the dimensions and decorations of which leave no doubt of its importance. Next door the former convent has been transformed into a spectacular space hosting a world-class collection of Mayan textiles. On the ground floor are rooms of both Spanish Colonial and pre-Hispanic art reminding us of the continuities of local history as well as differences. Lovers of textiles will spend hours opening the drawers containing examples collected over the past century of local Mayan villages\' creations. In all an exemplary museum and ambiance in this culturally rich and beautiful city.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

479523748.name: fabulous textiles - could have stayed all day
479523748.author: a TripAdvisor user
479523748.reviewBody: This museum has one of the best textile collections in Mexico, displayed to international standards (plan chests with glazed drawers, and glass cases with figures). I stayed for 2 hours - if photography had been allowed it might have been longer. The museum guard was very knowledgeable and gave us a lot of additional information in Spanish. The attached shop sells museum quality textiles made by indigenous women

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

476586336.name: Awesome museum of Chiapas textile history
476586336.author: a TripAdvisor user
476586336.reviewBody: Great museum highlighting the tradition of textile production in Chiapas, Tabasco, northern Guatemala. There are examples of actual fabrics from 1400 years ago, from which today\'s fabrics carry through the designs.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

471223281.name: Incredible!
471223281.author: a TripAdvisor user
471223281.reviewBody: One of the most important textile collections in the world, with very knowledgeable curators and wonderful design (of the exhibits and staging).  Well worth a visit to understand the history, tradition and current importance of cotton and wool textiles to the Mayan people of Chiapas and Guatemala.  A must if you\'re in San Cristobal.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

471144240.name: Great overview of Chiapas textiles
471144240.author: a TripAdvisor user
471144240.reviewBody: This small museum offers a compact view of the textiles of southern Mexico.  The quality of the displays is very high, and if you have additional time, you can pull out drawers that contain many additional samples of the textiles. There is a shop with high end products, and right outside the museum is a large open air market with less expensive local wares on sale.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

470175563.name: More than Textiles
470175563.author: a TripAdvisor user
470175563.reviewBody: The textiles are incredible and worth the price of admission alone.  But don\'t skip the rest of the museum , some great Maya and colonial items.  Also full scale reproductions of the murals at Bonapak.  Might actually the  best full scale view of those famous murals as the originals are very faded and degraded now.  \n\nThe museum store offers top quality hand made textiles .

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

468942925.name: Fabulous Exhibitions
468942925.author: a TripAdvisor user
468942925.reviewBody: Even my husband enjoyed this - once we\'d found the entrance!\nI spent a very enjoyable couple of hours in here, beautiful examples of Chiapas costumes on show and in drawers. Wonderful chair exhibition which I nearly missed. \n

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

468846138.name: Don\'t miss out on this.
468846138.author: a TripAdvisor user
468846138.reviewBody: To understand Mexico is in part to understand their crafts and this textile museum is the first one we\'ve seen dedicated to that understanding. It was exceptional taking you back through time with so many examples to explore. Enchanting journey in an enchanting monastery. They could not have done it better.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

468120021.name: Do Not Miss
468120021.author: a TripAdvisor user
468120021.reviewBody: Worthwhile trip to the textile museum. Only issue was that there is very little written in English. There are several interesting videos, but they are all in Spanish, no subtitles. Gorgeous textiles on the 2nd floor, beautifully displayed. Pull out the drawers, each is filled with another colorful treasure. Downstairs is an overview of art and history of Chiapas, plus an excellent temporary/special exhibit of a modern designer\'s use of Mayan textiles in fashion.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

467967974.name: Not to miss
467967974.author: a TripAdvisor user
467967974.reviewBody: Great place worth while. My only problem was the entry fee was $55 pesos I paid with a $500 and the lady said she did not have change so shw will "owe me the change", I explained that will not happened and promptly found change. I hte when people try to get advantage of tourist

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

467579485.name: What a surprise!
467579485.author: a TripAdvisor user
467579485.reviewBody: The museum downstairs is a lovely overview of the art and history of the region, but this textile collection upstairs is not to be missed. Gorgeous installation to world-class museum standards and an amazing collection of huipiles from throughout Chiapas. This was one of the highlights of our time in San Cris. (and the shop is terrific!)

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

465456305.name: Incredible collection of textiles: not to be missed
465456305.author: a TripAdvisor user
465456305.reviewBody: This museum is a triple-value: You walk through the artisan market to get here, then there are two museums housed in a historic ex-convent. The textiles alone are worth the visit. This is an incredible collection of weaving and embroidery. Many of the huipils and blouses are stunningly beautiful and reflect the incredible talents of these indigenous weavers. There are rooms full of drawers with examples of every type of weaving and embroidery; you could spend hours here enjoying the artisania.\n

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

464384533.name: Great exhibit
464384533.author: a TripAdvisor user
464384533.reviewBody: Very recently built museum  with a wonderful exhibit of the various textiles. these handcrafted items are the finest that you might see anywhere. Well worth visiting

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

462358271.name: Textiles, history too
462358271.author: a TripAdvisor user
462358271.reviewBody: They had an astonishing array of woven and embroidered \nGarments. Two very ironic things, they had a water dispenser with no cups, and you were not allowed to take pictures, but they had  a display with a hole for your head and hands.. you know, of another body, so you could pose as  nun, but we had to check cameras and cell phones, so.. no funny pictures.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

460886890.name: Interesting
460886890.author: a TripAdvisor user
460886890.reviewBody: For 55 pesos it\'s worth stopping in after you have been to the markets around it. There was an external exhibition by Roche Bobois taking place which was quite unique.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

455744405.name: A must see museum
455744405.author: a TripAdvisor user
455744405.reviewBody: This museum is located next to the Church of Santo Domingo. It is definitely a must see museum. You will learn about some history but also see the amazing crafts of the indigenous people and how their crafts talk about their way of life. We thoroughly enjoyed this museum.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

451330133.name: Beautiful Collection!
451330133.author: a TripAdvisor user
451330133.reviewBody: Wonderful collection of local textiles beautifully displayed and curated! I try to visit every time I am in San Cristobal. If you at all interested in textiles - this is a must see!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

450178626.name: Amazing collection of Mayan Textiles
450178626.author: a TripAdvisor user
450178626.reviewBody: This museum houses a great collection of Mayan textiles in an ex-convent. There\'s a short introduction including history and artifacts on the bottom floor. The second floor consists of an amazing collection of hand-made textiles ranging from local Mayan villages to the highland of Guatemala. Be sure to open the doors to see the treasures inside. If you like culture, fashion, design, patterns and hand-made crafts, this is a must see.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

446952097.name: Colors and Designs
446952097.author: a TripAdvisor user
446952097.reviewBody:
I didn't particularly want to visit the textiles portion of this museum. I just wanted to be with my wife and daughter so I dutifully went along. I was pleasantly surprised. There were 2 parts that I thought were particularly neat--no, make that three. In one room they have long drawers containing Mayan textiles from various regions in Mexico and Guatemala. Many of these pieces are quite old and yet have maintained their incredible beauty. 

I also enjoyed the exhibit of the clothing worn by a tradition Mayan wedding party. The entire exhibit was based on a black and white photograph taken of a wedding in 1963. Quite fascinating. I kept wondering how many of the wedding party were alive today. 

Because I am a fan of the show Project Runway (Again I thank my wife for opening my mind), I loved the last exhibit, where fashion designers used Mayan textiles and colors to fashion modern, wearable clothing. Tim Guns would have been impressed. I know I was. My wife kept saying that she would wear these fashions today. They were beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

446708300.name: Interesting and beautiful museum
446708300.author: a TripAdvisor user
446708300.reviewBody: There\'s a lot to see in this museum and it\'s in a really nice house. The people were really nice and showed me around even though I didn\'t buy a guided tour. \nThe clothes and everything about it are very beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

446370178.name: Not to be missed!
446370178.author: a TripAdvisor user
446370178.reviewBody: Beautiful convent restoration; world-class presentation of Mayan textiles, all in a very easy to digest format. Superb museum shop.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

445753262.name: Beautiful
445753262.author: a TripAdvisor user
445753262.reviewBody: Absolutely thrilled that I read about this museum and visited.  An amazing amount of various huipils woven by indigenous peoples representing all towns and areas in Chiapas.    The video is so informative, you are able to see the whole process of making these beautiful garments from the very beginning of spinning the yarns to the magnificent finished garment. Also on the first floor are beautiful paintings and carvings and ancient textiles. If you go and watch the video you will gain an appreciation for the beautiful garments you will see the Maya wearing and it will enrich your experience of this beautiful area of Mexico even more.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

445087766.name: Wonderfal displays of Indigenous weaving.
445087766.author: a TripAdvisor user
445087766.reviewBody: This museum provides a wonderful experience of the art of weaving in Chiapas. There are interesting videos explaining the weaving techniques, and the displays are sorted by regions. Close ups of the beautiful textiles are available by pulling out lighted drawers. I do not know much about textiles, but I found these exhibits fascinating.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

443347668.name: For those who like textiles
443347668.author: a TripAdvisor user
443347668.reviewBody: Excellent history of maya weaving...lot of exemples..beautiful pieces in the drowers..by regions until the very contemporary fashion ...short movie about know how...museum is redone recently and worth the money you pay...ground floor couple of masterpieces left by the conquistadores ...don\'t miss it especially if it\'s a grey day

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

441936169.name: visually and texturally interesting
441936169.author: a TripAdvisor user
441936169.reviewBody: the main museum on the ground floor is interesting for the history of Chiapas it showcases.  but the textile exhibit on the second floor is the real draw.  there are so many different patterns and fabrics that represent peoples from so many different towns/ villages.  there\'s a lot to absorb.  the presentation of how these fabrics and garments were originally made, and how they\'ve evolved is well done and informative.  the craftsmanship in general is truly spectacular.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

438603786.name: Good primer before San Juan Chamula and Zinacant\u00e1n
438603786.author: a TripAdvisor user
438603786.reviewBody: The exhibit and video explaining how Mayan textiles are made were fantastic. The staff won\'t allow you to bring "professional looking" cameras in, so if you want to take photos, bring an iPhone or point-and-shoot. The centro is next to the church of Santo Domingo in the heart of San Cristobal, so don\'t follow the map on Trip Advisor which will take you far out of town.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

437746809.name: Well-curated exhibits
437746809.author: a TripAdvisor user
437746809.reviewBody:
Loved it!  It is on the second floor of the museum and has a number of rooms.  

The textiles are spectacular and very local and varied.  You can pull out drawers to see more than those on display.  There is another room where traditional fabrics are used in modern designs too.  They had a video of the weaving, etc.  Downstairs, there are 3 pieces of fabric from about 600 AD!   They need more signage as it wasn't that easy to find.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

434854684.name: Need to go here to understand the region\'s textiles
434854684.author: a TripAdvisor user
434854684.reviewBody: The textile part of the museum is very good. Watch the film at the entrance to the museum \u2014 it shows the whole process of making the textiles that the region is famous four. Exhibits in english and Spanish. The first part of the museum \u2014 about San Cristobal is okay, but not great.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

434161337.name: Not to miss
434161337.author: a TripAdvisor user
434161337.reviewBody: This is a very comprehensive way of seeing all the different dresses of the Mayan Indians of the area. There are many master weavers and the culture is so diverse. Very interesting.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

431364509.name: A "Must See" in Chiapas (if you have any interest in fine native art)
431364509.author: a TripAdvisor user
431364509.reviewBody: If you enjoy experiencing the culture of the people who live in a place, you should make time to see this modern museum, which has so beautifully captured fine examples of Mayan weaving, embroidery and other textile art.  Well laid out.  English translations throughout.\n

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

418086437.name: Don\'t miss it.
418086437.author: a TripAdvisor user
418086437.reviewBody: An really incredible and outstanding collection of textiles of the Mayan region, specially from the highlands of Chiapas. The museography is superb in the old Dominican convent. A must!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

416552795.name: Worth a visit historical town center for , on the way to palenque from Tuxtla.
416552795.author: a TripAdvisor user
416552795.reviewBody: Worth a visit historical town center for , on the way to palenque from Tuxtla. If possible visit shamans of the Iglesia San Juan Bautista. practicing their healing arts with sacrificial chickens and clouds of incense, and taking part in a ritual to make corn liquor to be consumed during a celebration this week of Jesus Christ and the autumn equinox \u2014  the \u201cson\u201d and the sun, as only a Mayan town in Chiapas could meld two ancient religions.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

404996276.name: Not too be missed
404996276.author: a TripAdvisor user
404996276.reviewBody: Not only is it a lovely building with views of the city, it is one of the most thought our museums I have visited.  San Cristobal and surrounding villages are known for their unique (to each area) textiles, if  you know your local geography you can pick out villagers by their dress.  The museum shows examples from all over Chiapas.  The textiles are displayed in large drawers when opened are lit so you can appreciate the detail and are kept from fading, a very inventive way of display.  The gift shop, although pricey, has beautiful pillows and other linens for the home as well as clothes.  If the shop is above your budget you can step outside to the enormous outdoor market of local crafts which are  much more affordable but of course not of the quality of the gift shop.  Well worth the small admission price.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

399237836.name: A not to be missed experience
399237836.author: a TripAdvisor user
399237836.reviewBody: Stunning Museum in an architecturally gorgeous setting. If you love Mexican textiles, you should not miss this place

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

398310457.name: Hidden Jewel
398310457.author: a TripAdvisor user
398310457.reviewBody: Great display of textiles and clothing pieces were you can appreciate the different designs and quality of work. You can spend as mauch as you like, 15 min or three hours.dont bring your kids along, they will kill you !

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

387969657.name: Amazing textile collection of the diversity of Chiapas!
387969657.author: a TripAdvisor user
387969657.reviewBody: The museum is a joint venture between public and private institutions, aimed at conserving the ample textile heritage of Chiapas. Really worth the visit! The pieces in the museum shop are rather pricy! Around the Santa Domingo church you will find the sprawling market, nearly all around, with an enormous variety to choose from and with very reasonable prices.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

385579382.name: Stunning
385579382.author: a TripAdvisor user
385579382.reviewBody: This was the reason I wanted to visit San Cristobal de las casas & I was amazed! The garments on display are exquisite & I was happy to see the written description were in both Spanish & English. Well worth the visit!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

383892980.name: Great opportunity to learn about the culture!!
383892980.author: a TripAdvisor user
383892980.reviewBody:
The Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya is great place for us textile lovers. There's plenty of history and pieces on display for one to spend a day there. Located adjacent to the beautiful Santo Domingo temple, there's also a San Cristobal museum down stairs. 

All in all, a great place to be introduced to the city, Maya culture, history, the designs that live on and the people that make them. 

Tip: when you pay to get in make sure you get your ticket. There are guards on every section of the museum and you'll be asked to show it.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

377060146.name: Textiles galore!
377060146.author: a TripAdvisor user
377060146.reviewBody: A fabulous way to see the immense range of textile patterns created. A well designed system of drawers containing textiles made it simple to view!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

365508128.name: Best Museum I\'ve seen outside of DF
365508128.author: a TripAdvisor user
365508128.reviewBody: This museum, though not too big, is really worth your time and pesos. It\'s housed in a beautiful monastery and the collection on the first floor of Maya and Spanish artifacts is also included. The upstairs displays a nice collection of huipils and other garments worn by local groups. The space has been recently renovated and all in all makes for a thoughtfully curated installation. Honestly, it\'s in the running for best museum in Mexico outside of the capital city!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

365004284.name: Textile art extroardinaire!
365004284.author: a TripAdvisor user
365004284.reviewBody:
Beautiful building which houses a small colonial history display, too. Hundreds, it seems, of beautiful articles of clothing are displayed in drawers.  It's an art museum in a different media.  Very nice bathrooms.  You can get the gist of the textile portion of the museum in 45 minutes, but it would have been nice to stay all day to fully appreciate all the pieces of clothing. 

Could be good as a SHORT visit for children as the colors are so lively.  Also, it was nice to have informative videos as a way to rest weary travelers' feet.

An exciting aspect of this museum is its work with locals to keep artistic traditions alive while also developing products which could be used to support themselves.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

362136369.name: Wonderful visit
362136369.author: a TripAdvisor user
362136369.reviewBody: We enjoyed seeing the incredible textile collection and learning about the history of textiles in the Mayan world. Thankfully, we speak and read Spanish, so we could figure out the wonderful text placards downstairs. If you only speak/read another language, might be wise to read about the place before visiting. The history related to weavers within the Mayan creation story was really fascinating.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

361919722.name: You have to go here to see it all!
361919722.author: a TripAdvisor user
361919722.reviewBody: Make sure while in the museum to open the drawers in the museum cases.  Nobody told us about this, but we saw someone else doing it.. Great views, great textiles.... love it!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

360763515.name: Very innovative
360763515.author: a TripAdvisor user
360763515.reviewBody: We visited this museum with a recommendation from friends. Normally this would not interest us, but the way all the blouses and tops were displayed was wonderful. Many were in pull out drawers with lighting which was a nice way to see all of them. There were several videos playing to learn the different textiles and how they were made. Even had a wedding party displayed with their native garbs.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

360754854.name: Great for textile buffs
360754854.author: a TripAdvisor user
360754854.reviewBody: Large displays and endless drawers to open and inspect.  Some fabulous work here, so leave plenty of time if you have any serious interest.  It takes a while to open and close all those drawers!  Admission is combined with the Museo Central Altos de Chiapas which is also worth your time.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

356208914.name: Really good museum of textiles
356208914.author: a TripAdvisor user
356208914.reviewBody: Really good museum of textiles of most of Central America, also has several good exhibits of Spanish history and the Catholic Church in Mexico.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

354350917.name: Dazzling colors
354350917.author: a TripAdvisor user
354350917.reviewBody: This museum is a lovely tribute to the skill and artistry of Maya women who have been weaving for millennia. The garments are sensitively displayed, lovingly curated.  In addition to the manikins, there are drawers to pull out, in which huipiles and cortes are lain flat.  And the shop complements the museum, with woven items from contemporary Maya communities.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

352739284.name: Comprehensive Collection
352739284.author: a TripAdvisor user
352739284.reviewBody: Extraordinary collection of textiles from the Mayan world beautifully displayed and preserved.  Make sure to pull,out the drawers below the display cases to see more fine textiles.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

352409942.name: The best textile museum I\'ve ever been to.
352409942.author: a TripAdvisor user
352409942.reviewBody: Amazing textile museum with local samples from many, many communities from Chiapas to Guatemala.  Very well displayed in individual drawers with lighting for each.  Well worth the visit.\nIn comparing this to the Oaxaca Textile Museum this is light years ahead in both its collection and displays.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

352175104.name: Beautiful
352175104.author: a TripAdvisor user
352175104.reviewBody: A tour of the free museum is a must while in the city.    Fabric and costume types from all parts of the Yucatan and beyond are beautifully presented in the air conditioned museum galleries.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

350694270.name: Beautifully displayed textiles
350694270.author: a TripAdvisor user
350694270.reviewBody: My sisters and I went to the Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya  in Feb. 2016 - not a large display but what was available was beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

350638029.name: a visual drink of water
350638029.author: a TripAdvisor user
350638029.reviewBody: Wonderful beyond words if you are a textile collector or have an interest in these amazing examples of traje.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

350618866.name: Fabulous
350618866.author: a TripAdvisor user
350618866.reviewBody: I was totally surprised at the size of the textile collection at the museum.  Drawer after drawer revealed textiles from various pueblas.  As you open each drawer a light comes on for easier viewing of the fine details.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

347097221.name: Well Worth Visit
347097221.author: a TripAdvisor user
347097221.reviewBody: The ex-convento was nice, but it was mainly housing for a very good textile museum.  The museum house several collections of textile and we came out with much better understanding of indigenous dress by region.  Allowed to open many drawers displaying additional textiles.  Well worth time and 55 peso entry fee.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

344800606.name: A must for people who appreciate textiles of Mexico
344800606.author: a TripAdvisor user
344800606.reviewBody: This textile museum offers a fabulous collection of textiles from Chiapas and Guatemala.  My visit to this museum was the highlight of my time in San Crist\u00f3bal de las Casas!

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

343843332.name: Great Textile Examples from Several Nearby Regions
343843332.author: a TripAdvisor user
343843332.reviewBody: My kids (age 6 and 10) most enjoyed the textiles on the second floor. They spent a lot of time opening drawers and comparing the different attributes of the textiles (fringe, color, pattern, gender, etc.) We also enjoyed some of the pots and other artifacts in the first room downstairs. Many of the religious paintings weren\'t to our taste, but we moved through those quickly. The courtyard is simple, and I got a couple of fantastic pictures of the kids with the top of the church in the background. The museum cost 60 pesos per adult and the kids were free. Plan for 1-2 hours.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

342971678.name: Unique collection of Mayan textiles
342971678.author: a TripAdvisor user
342971678.reviewBody: This is an exhaustive collection of Mayan shirts,dresses and all sort of textiles displayed in hundreds of drawers and perfectly preserved. The variety of designs and the vivid colours of the garments make this a unique museum complemented with insightful explanatory videos. Not to miss if you have any interest in Mayan culture or textiles history.

itemReviewed.name: Centro de Textiles del Mundo Maya

address.streetAddress: Av 20 de Noviembre

673324889.name: due to repairs, we could not see much
673324889.author: a TripAdvisor user
673324889.reviewBody: I think the church is being repaired from earthquake damage so plastic sheeting was over all the inner walls. But what was visible was beautiful as well as the outside of the church.

660333020.name: Restoration work is in progress and little can be seen; but pay a visit to the surrounding market !
660333020.author: a TripAdvisor user
660333020.reviewBody:
The church is open, but the interior is in under restoration: the walls are completely covered by enormous plastic sheets, and nothing can be seen. Nobody knows when the works will terminate, but it is to be expected that they will last long. The façade is however visible, although some fences partially obstruct it. This Churrigueresque façade is one of the most beautiful in Mexico: it is totally sculpted and decorated, and it is definitely the best sight in San Cristóbal.

Even if the visit of Santo Domingo will leave you unsatisfied, the visit of the large handicrafts market which surrounds the church will largely compensate your disappointment. There are innumerable stalls selling textiles, clothing and other artefacts made with fabrics. Overall, this market is one of the most colourful in Latin America and recalls the famous market of Chichicastenango in Guatemala, although on a smaller scale (by the way, it is said that some of the products on sale here come from Guatemala). The items on sale are very beautiful, often exceptionally beautiful, and the prices are definitely moderate; bargaining is considered an acceptable practice, and this contributes to reducing the prices. As an example, I bought a marvellous woollen ski-cap and a pair of woollen gloves; both were hand-knitted, both were made with a very large amount of high-quality wool, and the asked price was 100 Pesos only (about 5 US $); I didn’t have the nerve of bargaining ! The discerning traveller will certainly find very interesting the human environment of this market. Sellers are all women of indio descent; they are generally dressed in their traditional embroidered costumes and, in addition to selling their goods, they perform an impressive number of other tasks, like knitting, embroidering, taking care of their children and, if it is the case, even breast-feeding a newborn. Taking pictures in the market is advised against; especially taking pictures of people.

Adjoining the church there is a convent, which contains a museum of the Mayan textile: admission is on payment; I have not visited it. In the same building there is also a large shop selling beautiful textiles and claiming to be a cooperative of local artisans. The items on sale are mostly embroidered blouses or embroidered cushion covers: they are definitely very beautiful, sometimes exceptionally beautiful; but the standardization of their design, the faultless precision of their weaving and the great number of identical items present in the store gives the feeling that they are machine-made. Prices are very steep, and bargaining is rejected. You can pay by credit card or cash, and there is a 10 % discount for cash payment; they also accept some foreign currencies (e.g. the US $). Even if you are not planning to buy anything it is worth to have a look.

647288218.name: Lovely
647288218.author: a TripAdvisor user
647288218.reviewBody: the church with the interesting facade! i admire the local government for helping maintain its original structure

643637204.name: Santo Domingo Church
643637204.author: a TripAdvisor user
643637204.reviewBody: This is a beautiful church and and the way that was built just stunning all stone hand made and outside the church you\u2019ll find all the artisans whit all that beautiful colors that characterizes Chiapas on their handcrafts from blouses, hats, scarfs, etc..

639381423.name: A must see stop
639381423.author: a TripAdvisor user
639381423.reviewBody: While this church was undergoing earthquake damage repair, the architecture of this church must be seen

632524909.name: Beautiful
632524909.author: a TripAdvisor user
632524909.reviewBody: So the interior is presently unable to be viewed due to earthquake damage - this is a pity.\nHowever the exterior is beautiful-----intricate Baroque stucco which looks beautiful in the afternoon setting sun....and right next door is a wonderful modern museum - not to be missed.\nSo the hawkers and vendors have set up in front of the church, taking over the square, but they are only trying to make a living and leave you alone if you respectfully say "no gracias"

631361168.name: lovely church to visit briefly and look at
631361168.author: a TripAdvisor user
631361168.reviewBody: For our anniversary this year my husband and I went to a few places in Mexico including San Cristobal de las Casas. One place worth checking out there was the Templo de Santo Domingo.\n\nThe exterior was beautiful. But there were a ton of vendors with little tents set up outside which distracted from the beauty. Inside the church was very pretty as well. There was a wall of gold with images of saints throughout. It\'s not really my thing to decorate a church like that, but it is art and it was worth visiting. It won\'t take long and you will get to see an building with a lot of heart.

615568168.name: Speechless
615568168.author: a TripAdvisor user
615568168.reviewBody: Probably the most beautiful church I have ever seen. It\u2019s small but the baroque style gives such an amazing scenery that you could stay seated there admiring the ceilin and the beautiful art around for hours.

589589699.name: CLOSED !
589589699.author: a TripAdvisor user
589589699.reviewBody: The roof has collapsed and the church is CLOSED  Others in the area are also closed. The roofs are covered with tarps and repairs are under way. It will take some time.

581274276.name: Earthquake damage
581274276.author: a TripAdvisor user
581274276.reviewBody: Following upon the earthquake in September 2017 the doors are open but the majority of the interior is cordoned off and under plastic wraps for protection, with wooden scaffolding supporting arches in a side chapel..  Patches of plaster have fallen off and I am surprised entry is allowed.  People are complaining that the Govt is doing nothing to restore the building, and this is the situation throughout San Cris - the Cathedral and just about every church has tarps on roofs, scaffolding, and are closed to prevent injuries.  That\'s a lot of churches and just that alone would have been costly. The people themselves don\'t seem to be doing anything, unlike in Puebla with a similar earthquake damage problem where the residents are raising money and undertaking repairs.  It\'s almost difficult to access the church due to the cheap souvenirs market dominating the area.

569466780.name: The construction
569466780.author: a TripAdvisor user
569466780.reviewBody: This lovely chuch is very detaild like the others seen in same states, simple, part of thi history of this great state

568128222.name: Beautiful facade, nice market
568128222.author: a TripAdvisor user
568128222.reviewBody: From the main plaza it\u2019s just four blocks to the north to get to the artesanal market which surrounds the Santo Domingo church. The market feels like a labyrinth.. and once you find yourself in front of the beautiful facade of Santo Domingo. Don\u2019t miss the entrance on the right side to see the inside. Right next to the Santo Domingo Church is the \u2018Centro de textiles del Mundo Maya\u2019 which must be alo worth a visit. Enjoy this beautiful city.

568103711.name: Tourist Trap
568103711.author: a TripAdvisor user
568103711.reviewBody: This church itself is under resconstruction because it was hit by the earthquake - it is probably beautiful, once it is restored. However, surrounding the construction site, there is an extremely touristy market, selling mostly cheap fake and/or industrially produced \u201eauthentic\u201c souvenirs.

559906486.name: Great Architecture
559906486.author: a TripAdvisor user
559906486.reviewBody:
There’s no way you will miss this gorgeous Temple. Due to the recent April in September, 2017 it is only open ag certain hours of the day, check hours if you like to visit the inside that’s currently being remodeled but you can still capture great photos of the front side as you pass by. 

This temple is located right in front of the best local market to buy all your souvenirs. 

One of the positive things of this “ Pueblo Mágico” is the fact that their government puts a lot of efforts on rebuilding the damaged buildings and every church or cathedral in town is already being remodeled and not abandoned . Bravo to the city organizations who are working hard for tourism and their locals to have their local monuments back! 

Enjoy your trip !

558703892.name: Active on All Sides
558703892.author: a TripAdvisor user
558703892.reviewBody: The building front is beautiful in afternoon light. The property is surrounded by a public craft market, food vendors and busy street extending to the nearby public market. This and the adjacent activities are a must see in San Cris. We walk here twice a week to enjoy the colorful textiles, buy fresh vegetables and just enjoy the public activity. Take your time, there\'s much to see.

553585284.name: Amazing facade!
553585284.author: a TripAdvisor user
553585284.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful church facades I have ever seen. The church was locked, unfortunately, such that we could not visit inside.

535441445.name: Very unique!!!
535441445.author: a TripAdvisor user
535441445.reviewBody: Very unique!!! vey different from the common churches in Latin America, not very far away from the main square.

517995341.name: Beautiful church and amazing market place nearby
517995341.author: a TripAdvisor user
517995341.reviewBody: The markets outside are a must see! The church itself is filled with gold plated walls and shouldn\'t be missed but the markets are the main draw here. Be sure to try and drive a hard bargain but expect stiffness on certain items (e.g cushion cases which take up to 4 weeks to make by hand!) \n

512030575.name: Beautiful
512030575.author: a TripAdvisor user
512030575.reviewBody: In Mexico you come across a lot of cathedrals and churches but for some reason the Templo de Santo Domingo stood out to me. The detailing within the baroque facade was stunning - architecture enthusiasts would be in absolute paradise with this one! Contrasting against a blue sky is probably the most ideal day (as is often the case) but I wouldn\'t let a rainy day put you off a visit either

505648847.name: Walking down San Cristobal
505648847.author: a TripAdvisor user
505648847.reviewBody: All of the churches and traditions are walking distance...get to know about the chocolate, coffee, traditional food and buy an artesania. Get your warm sweatter, it gets chilli in the morning and evenings.

500560082.name: beautiful facade and finest artesanias!
500560082.author: a TripAdvisor user
500560082.reviewBody: santo domingo church is an example of extraordinary and elegant architecture.\nhighly recommend the artesanal offical store next to it! they have the finest handmade towels, napkins, cushion covers, etc.

498996631.name: Beautiful church
498996631.author: a TripAdvisor user
498996631.reviewBody: We enjoyed visiting this beautiful church which is very different from European churches. A must see on your visit to San Christobal.

495745333.name: Typical Latin American church
495745333.author: a TripAdvisor user
495745333.reviewBody: Nothing except the outside of this church makes it stand out from all other churches in Latin America. On the other hand there\'s nothing to stop you from visiting it if you like churches!

493543657.name: Cool church
493543657.author: a TripAdvisor user
493543657.reviewBody: I could see the Templo de Santo Domingo from my hotel and it looked spectacular. The Church itself is really interesting looking. Outside of the templo, on the day I went there were plenty of vendors selling schlock but it was fun to walk around.

490437348.name: Symbol of Dominican Power in Chiapas
490437348.author: a TripAdvisor user
490437348.reviewBody: During the early colonial period the Dominican order held sway in Chiapas and San Cristobal was their center. No wonder, then, that their major church outstrips all others in the city in size and splendor.
