123135154.reviewBody: An interesting piece of history and a good place to find a local guide for visiting nearby indigenous villages.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

122952609.name: very interesting
122952609.author: a TripAdvisor user
122952609.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the DVD presentation because it will help you understand what you will see in the museum. The food at the restaurant was great.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

122719757.name: Really interesting
122719757.author: a TripAdvisor user
122719757.reviewBody: Beautiful peaceful setting and a feeling that you are stepping back in time, very much enjoyed this visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

121780711.name: lovely house
121780711.author: a TripAdvisor user
121780711.reviewBody: The film is good and the exhibits well done. The staff are not very interested. There is a piano concert which I will try

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

120361657.name: Awsome place plenty of history !!
120361657.author: a TripAdvisor user
120361657.reviewBody: We just went to take a look and were fascinated by the history of the Centre. They assist the indian community and area very proud to show their pieces and share their culture. It is also a museum so you can take a look of the past and be amazed by the people who bring it out and now is dedicated to teach and care about this amazing culture. Nothing bad to said just wish I have had more time!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

119536844.name: Up close and personal museum
119536844.author: a TripAdvisor user
119536844.reviewBody: I had never visited a museum with such a strong energy. Take your time and enjoy immersing yourself into Lacandonian culture. If you are lucky you might meet closely with artisans from one of the surrounding towns that come directly to sell their work.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

116726988.name: Worthwhile visit to a secret garden
116726988.author: a TripAdvisor user
116726988.reviewBody: We had a little trouble finding Na Bolom, but was worth the effort.  It is a tribute an American couple who worked with local villages and traditions. the museum has a really nice garden out the back featuring a photographic exhibition.   The gift shop sells crafts made by locals and all the proceeds are used for local villages and keeping the traditions alive.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

116613123.name: Wanted to stay forever
116613123.author: a TripAdvisor user
116613123.reviewBody: Although it may be a kind of museum I felt like it was a home and the residents were just out for the afternoon.  I loved this house so much.  Not central to the historic district but easy enough to walk to if you have a good map.  They have concerts here a few times a week in the evenings in the chapel with a grand piano.  Do not miss coming here if you are interested in Mexican decor, the bedroom of Truddi Blom is so lovely!  I could feel her presence.  Go.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

91470096.name: Stepping back in time...
91470096.author: a TripAdvisor user
91470096.reviewBody: The cultural center is a converted house of the original founders of San Cristobal. You can walk through the house and look at the sleeping quarters, library, dining area, courtyards, and garden in the same conditions as they were back then. If you have the time, have a coffee and enjoy the sunshine and view. The walk is towards a more suburban area, so don\'t be alerted if you think you\'ve made a wrong turn.

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

77684821.name: Step out of your world.
77684821.author: a TripAdvisor user
77684821.reviewBody:
Founded in  1951 in a hacienda built in 1890s, Na-Bolom is a museum complex/inn in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico, dedicated to preserving the rain forest and the way of life of the Lancandon Indians, descendants of the Mayas.  When I was there in 2005 three Indians in native garb joined us for  breakfast  and conversation around a fireplace in the beautiful dining room. (There is always a place for them at Na-Bolom when they need to come to town) 

The city is high in the mountains and can be cold when you are out of the sun in January. But each room at Na-Bolom has a fireplace and a nice man brings a wheel-barrow full of wood for it each morning. We took a day tour to several nearby villages (Zinacatan & San Juan Chapula ...home of the Zapitistes) where we learned about and experienced the local culture. Simply fantastic. 

At Na-Bolom my friend and I  were able to hire a car and driver for $240 each to take us on a 3-day trip into the jungle. The driver was a wonderful young family man, spoke some English and was very much interested in improving. So our trip was also a moving classroom for both he and I. Went to Palenque, Aqua Azul, Misol-Ha, Bonampak, etc. We stayed in a cabin at the edge of a native village one night, were taken up the Rio Usamacintas, the river separating Mexico and Guatemala,  to the remote ruins at  Yaxchilan. Maybe best of all, we got to take a walk in the jungle for as long as we liked. I loved every bit of it. (I was 77) 

Of course bring a camera, good walking shoes, clothes for hot days but don't bother much about the cold. Buy a heavy wool sweater like the natives wear in the local market for about $18. You should plan to be in San Cristobal de las Casas for about a week to enjoy all there is to see and do. And besides, it's a long winding trip by bus to get there!

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

65595681.name: Fascinating and charming place
65595681.author: a TripAdvisor user
65595681.reviewBody: This is a fascinating house which still does fantastic work in the community in the education of children. The introduction video is very interesting, but the house itself is beautiful, with a lovely courtyard, interesting display rooms that surround it and a large and beautiful garden. The centre is still lived in and you can stay here too. It has the feel of a kibbutz, or community, with a large dining room and library sitting area. \n\nA must see when in San Cristobal

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

59764295.name: Magical
59764295.author: a TripAdvisor user
59764295.reviewBody: It is a privilege to stay and participate. How can u say you have b een to SCLC if you have not had dinner at Na Bolom?

address.streetAddress: Calle Vicente Guerrero No. 33 Barrio El Cerrillo

665962555.name: Great View of San Cristobal
665962555.author: a TripAdvisor user
665962555.reviewBody: Two churches will afford you a nice view of San Cristobal: Iglesia Guadalupe (good), Iglesia del Cerrito (better). Unfortunately the little church was closed, but the intention of the hike up the 150 or so steps was for the view. We brought a little picnic and enjoyed at the top. Too bad trash litters the way up, it could be a really pretty church and walk if better taken care of. Still, the hike up the steps is worth the view of town.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

640877344.name: view
640877344.author: a TripAdvisor user
640877344.reviewBody: The view is amazing look out over the whole city. Its an good exercise to to get up the stairs. but worth it!

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

633631836.name: Go for the exercise; stay for the views
633631836.author: a TripAdvisor user
633631836.reviewBody: This is a great way to get a little exercise and take in a lovely view. The church is okay...NBD, but if you venture beyond the parking lot and telecom towers behind the church, there are some little trails that the local joggers seem to enjoy in the mornings.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

577669241.name: Beautiful Church
577669241.author: a TripAdvisor user
577669241.reviewBody: This is a Beautiful church located at the top of a hill, beautiful view from the top. Every few steps turn around to see the view of San Cristobal town.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

577241152.name: Worth the stairs
577241152.author: a TripAdvisor user
577241152.reviewBody: A nice church to visit up on the hill overlooking San Cristobal. There is a good view from here.It is centrally located and the walk up is pleasant!

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

569106531.name: Small Church on a Hill - The Views are Worth the Steep Climb!
569106531.author: a TripAdvisor user
569106531.reviewBody:
This is the second church in San Cristobal that can be found at the top of a hill (the Guadalupe Church is the other one), but the Iglesia del Cerrito is much higher. There were approximately 240 steps to the top of the hill where this small church was perched and it looked quite daunting, standing at the bottom! Thankfully, the stairs were designed in a zig zag pattern with benches and flat areas along the way which made things easier. There were trees and houses along the sides of the long staircase as well. The elevation in San Cristobal was already high and I was feeling the effects (lightheaded, headache), so I took my time climbing them and stopped for breaks to catch my breath.

I finally made it to the top where there were fantastic views of the city below. The church was pretty and surrounded by a forest. There were some picnic benches and a washroom at the top too. It was a peaceful place and I enjoyed relaxing there and taking in the views. 

On the way down the steps, there were a group of young local men sitting on the steps at the bottom and I was the only tourist around at midday, which resulted in some uncomfortable cat-calling for me. It felt harmless and not threatening, but was still unwanted and something to be aware of if you are a solo female. Because this church is a little away from the central area and there are hidden areas along the stairs, I wouldn’t recommend going here after dark and early in the morning for solo females.

Definitely check out the views from the top of this church. The steep climb is worth it!

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

539551812.name: A Steep Climb
539551812.author: a TripAdvisor user
539551812.reviewBody: Another quaint church in San Cristobal that provides a nice view of the city from the steep stairways that lead up to it

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

534143704.name: Nice little church @ the top
534143704.author: a TripAdvisor user
534143704.reviewBody: Just a nice little church .... I do not recommend visiting with children as they could feel tired after so many steps.  The view is nice from the top.  Once you get to the top you can visit the church, no fees.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

492551526.name: Worth the climb for the view
492551526.author: a TripAdvisor user
492551526.reviewBody: Small church located up a steep set of steps. While the interior of the church doesn\'t have a great lot to check out, the view from various points of the ascent make it worth the trip if you have some spare time to kill in the city.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

482245713.name: excellent view.
482245713.author: a TripAdvisor user
482245713.reviewBody: 250 steps!!! is a long way to climb but worth the view. Nice picture from san cristobal de las casas.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

460044233.name: Great view!!
460044233.author: a TripAdvisor user
460044233.reviewBody: It\'s a short (but steep!!) hike to get to this church and I was a little upset to find out it was closed for renovation, but the views make the effort worth your while!

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

458814422.name: A jewelry to visit!
458814422.author: a TripAdvisor user
458814422.reviewBody: Most people just visit the main cathedral in San Cristobal, but definetly visiting this church on top of a hill is a great experience. It\u00b4s necessary to walk a bit from downtown to get there, but when you climb the hill and get on top of the church it offers a beautiful view. The church is kind of small but the view and landscape that it offers is great. it is really worth to visit it during the day or at night.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

458812709.name: Fun little time filler
458812709.author: a TripAdvisor user
458812709.reviewBody: The steps to this church begin only a few blocks from the Cathedral de San Crist\u00f3bal. After a long bus ride, we decided to stretch our legs and walk to the top. It\'s a lot of steps to the view of the city, maybe 200 or so...though the view is actually better as you\'re climbing, since the trees block most of the view from the top. There is a road that leads there if you\'d rather drive, but then I don\'t really see the point, since there\'s really nothing to see. The simple little church was closed, and there\'s nothing but a parking lot in the back. This is definitely not a must-do, but I enjoyed the exercise and view of the city in which we had just arrived.

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

455744562.name: Lots of steps
455744562.author: a TripAdvisor user
455744562.reviewBody: After climbing a lot of steps you finally get to the Cerritos church, which is very simple and there\'s not much to see but a view of the city

address.streetAddress: Corner of Hermanos Dominguez

674836674.name: Meaningless
674836674.author: a TripAdvisor user
674836674.reviewBody: I know that I shouldn\'t compare the places that I see while traveling, but I found the \nLagunas de Montebello pretty meaningless. Maybe they\'re important for the locals, but from a tourist standpoint there\'s nothing special to see.\nI would rather spend my time somewhere else.

646699399.name: Great Landscapes!
646699399.author: a TripAdvisor user
646699399.reviewBody: This place is worth a visit with wonderful views to the magnificent lakes near the Guatemala border. At least 5 lakes to visit.

642431144.name: Beautiful lake
642431144.author: a TripAdvisor user
642431144.reviewBody: It\u2019s a beautiful lake to relax. Not much something special. It\u2019s long way to get there too. Better take a tour that organized in San Cristobal.

640930059.name: Secluded and still relatively preserved
640930059.author: a TripAdvisor user
640930059.reviewBody:
We put the lakes on our bucket list when we planned the trip. We travelled with our own car and visited Chiflon in the morning and continued to the lakes. Upon entering the park, the general route goes to the right as if you continue straight you will run in to two small lakes.

Nevertheless, we continued straight and then took the unpaved road (unplanned) which took us through the most authentic mayan village we have seen. Then we returned to the same path that we were supposed to take and continued onwards to lake Tziscao and Lago Internacional. There we crossed briefly (on foot) into Guatemala. There are no border checks on this place and people on both sides are selling eachothers goods and seem related. Also, they all accept Mexican Peso as the form of payment and state their prices upfront in Pesos.

On the return we stopped at lake Montebello and were a bit disappointed as there was a lot of foam on the shores and an amazing lake seemed polluted. We were also advised by the locals that we shouldn't swim in the lake.

In any case, combined with Chiflon waterfall it's worth a visit.

640076493.name: Lovely in dry season and when it\'s warm - spring
640076493.author: a TripAdvisor user
640076493.reviewBody: Best to go with a private guide, all the prepackaged tours have you with at least eight hours on the road. Privately you can stop in Comitan and have a hot chocolate and see the lovely z\u00f3calo, stop in Teopisca and eat typical food, eat at one of the lakes the wonderful typical foods. Yes we like to eat. Chiflon is a day of its own, wich the prepackaged tours include.

639292985.name: Stunningly secluded
639292985.author: a TripAdvisor user
639292985.reviewBody: The lakes of Montebello are wonderfully quiet and offer some respite from the town of San Cristobal. They offer great views over the lakes that make for a great picture. One of the lakes is a lovely blue colour and the other an emerald, green colour. You can rent a small boat for the lake and thus taking your own tour around this beautiful ecosystem. If you venture further up the road there is a small pier out to the lake that makes for an even better photo!

619036743.name: Breathtaking!
619036743.author: a TripAdvisor user
619036743.reviewBody: It was a great activity for my group of friends. We had the opportunity to row boats on a rainy day which was a great experience. We water looks more beautiful when the sun is out, but the clouds and the rain made so special!

616516286.name: Amazing trip and expericen
616516286.author: a TripAdvisor user
616516286.reviewBody: one of a kid places to visit. the whole trip is worth it. you can find wild life, natural falls, and the view during the whole trip from chiapa de corzo util the dam is amazing.

584159188.name: Visit the lakes was one of our main points to visit.
584159188.author: a TripAdvisor user
584159188.reviewBody: It is a long drive but we had an stop in El Chiflon water falls. IN the lake you can try to ride a raft to visit the island and a cenote. The lake is colorful and they do not use motor ships to keep the lake natural. Very nice place to see.

573574498.name: Just amazing!
573574498.author: a TripAdvisor user
573574498.reviewBody:
Although all Chiapas is incredible, Lagunas de Montebello is one of the astonishing places within the wonders of that Mexican Estate.

The tour had another previous attraction, so we arrived by lunch time (basic food, fish will be the choice). There are so many lagunas but we enjoyed only 2.
You take a raft to get to a little island where  swimming is allowed and there are some orchids to see. And we went to a cenote like lagoon.

Be prepared to get wet, specially in rainy seasons, and take an extra change of clothes. 
At the entrance you will find food kiosks. I recommend Pozol and Champurrado (cocoa drinks) and of course the coffee.

The landscape is amazing and listening to nothing but nature transport you to another planet! This national park is close to the Guatemalan border and is a must see.

569467208.name: A must!!!
569467208.author: a TripAdvisor user
569467208.reviewBody: In the woods, very lovely, in the border betewen M\u00e9xico and Guatemala, you can take a boat that takes you and see another country, the views Are great

672518422.name: Informative and delicious!
672518422.author: a TripAdvisor user
672518422.reviewBody:
I had gone to chocolaterias before, but it was my husband's first time, and he LOVED it! It has ruined "traditional" chocolates for him forever. 

Kakaw does an excellent job of presenting the importance and production of cacao to its visitors in a way that is informative and inviting. Oh, and their products are incredible. I had a 100% cacao drink and it was delicious. 

You can also get a ticket here to visit the jade museum nearby, which I also recommend. It makes for a fantastic day in San Cristobal!

We brought home plenty of samples and are still raving about it to family and friends. I would definitely recommend this to anyone in San Cristobal.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

666492606.name: Greatest hot chocolate of all time
666492606.author: a TripAdvisor user
666492606.reviewBody: We didn\u2019t actually visit the museum, just popped in to try the famous hot chocolate and it was so worth it! A must.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

656362564.name: NOW I KNOW KAKAW
656362564.author: a TripAdvisor user
656362564.reviewBody: The history and explanation of Cacao. Why Mexico was number 1 and fell to number 17 because of plague. When it was first used and why.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

634223057.name: Interesting visit
634223057.author: a TripAdvisor user
634223057.reviewBody: I would not go out of my way to see this, but I was part of a group and it was part of our itinerary.  One of the agents gave us a history of cacao along with a tasting.   We ordered hot chocolate afterwards and wished we had requested the one with more sugar.   It is an interesting stop and it has nice bathrooms.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

615402779.name: Worth a visit and with a good variety of chocolate to buy.
615402779.author: a TripAdvisor user
615402779.reviewBody: Small but nicely done. Interesting collection of objects used in the process around a central cafe. Great shop.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

609702312.name: Great escape from the rain
609702312.author: a TripAdvisor user
609702312.reviewBody: The museum isn\u2019t big and barely justifies the time or cost - but oh that hot chocolate. From 60% to 100% cacao - choose your \u201cpoison\u201d, pick milk or water, and maybe spice it up with some alcohol and you have pure joy served in a hug-mug for merely $50MX. Can\u2019t beat that on a rainy day.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

604704255.name: This is a "must" stop, for a Chocolate lover
604704255.author: a TripAdvisor user
604704255.reviewBody: Here\'s a GREAT late afternoon stop while visiting San Cristobal.\nThis well laid out museum has a lot to offer from static displays to live tasting. Most of the captioned displays also feature English translations too. Go ahead, I dare you not to buy some chocolate at the end of this tour!

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

596999730.name: A MUST STOP AND LEARN!!!
596999730.author: a TripAdvisor user
596999730.reviewBody: I took the tour and it was unbelievable all the history and facts of chocolate. Chiapas has the best chocolate in all the world. If you want the best QUALITY, kakaw is a must to stop.  Most of the chocolate commercial producers sell us sugar and fat and other crap.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

584158355.name: This place is very special, you can see the history of cacao
584158355.author: a TripAdvisor user
584158355.reviewBody: The history how the Mayans were using and consuming the cacao is interesting. They have a drawing that shows the value of the cacao seeds and is interesting to see the high value then. At the end you try different levels of cacao and sugar from 100% to 50% and you realize the difference in flavor. With the ticket you can also visit the Jade Museum which is right the corner.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

573844912.name: Not worth the stop
573844912.author: a TripAdvisor user
573844912.reviewBody: They do not offer any classes in english and there is very little english written anywhere.  We therefor skipped the museum upstairs. The employes speak ZERO english too.  Prices were high and they offered very little samples so difficult to decide what to buy if any.   We enjoyed the mayan hot chocolate but not the chocolate milkshakes.  Not sure it\'s worth a stop.

itemReviewed.name: Kakaw Museo del Cacao & Chocolateria Cultural

address.streetAddress: Calle 1ro. de Marzo # 16 Centro Historico

676662562.name: Great experience!
676662562.author: a TripAdvisor user
676662562.reviewBody: We walked in for the morning cooking class at eleven. We were four people and Amy from Steps. She gave us a lot of background informations about traditional life of the region. We cooked quesadillas from scrach on a stove. The two hours were a great esperience, really recommandable!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

671897901.name: Learn to cook delicious mexican food!
671897901.author: a TripAdvisor user
671897901.reviewBody: This a great place to visit if you are around San Cristobal. We learned how to make tamalas (sweet and savoury), jalapeno sauce and poncho. So interesting and fun! Carla was great at explaining the process from scratch and giving us extra info about the background of each dish. We really appreciated that she took us in for a Sunday evening session, and it was only me and my partner. Very dedicated and for a good cause. Thank you!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

671446079.name: the best place in San Crist\u00f3bal!
671446079.author: a TripAdvisor user
671446079.reviewBody:
This place is really wonderful, it has the best staff, I love the cooking workshop "do it by yourself" Definitely the best place to get to know the real culture here in San Cristóbal, highly recommended ♥️
Really cheap as well!!! 
I'll be back

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

670627962.name: Very interesting
670627962.author: a TripAdvisor user
670627962.reviewBody: I loved the cooking class so much because it wasn\'t like a cooking class in America at all. The tortilla making was so different and to use the comal instead of a microwave to make quesadillas was longer but more interesting plus quesadillas were better than using a microwave quesadilla. Also we got to make Pozol, which is a tradicional drink made out of corn. Overall the class was amazing!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

669012700.name: Great organization
669012700.author: a TripAdvisor user
669012700.reviewBody: My friends and I went to their storytelling workshop and their cooking class, and loved both! Very informative and fun. You leave there feeling great, having learned a lot and supporting an organization that is working on great projects.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

664069060.name: Steps cookery - fun, educational and delicious!!
664069060.author: a TripAdvisor user
664069060.reviewBody:
Fantastic! We did the 11am cooking class - you can book or just turn up. It’s $100 per person which is amazing when you get to learn so much, take part in making tortillas, quesadillas, salsa and pozol and of course you get to eat it too! 

The money (and any extra donation you can afford) goes to support local indigenous communities and particularly with education. 

Really recommended - fun, educational and delicious! Well done to the Steps project. They do other things as well including story telling st 3pm and a different cookery session at 7pm.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

662854180.name: Fun cooking class
662854180.author: a TripAdvisor user
662854180.reviewBody: Lots of stories and fun talking to other travelers. I\'ve hand made tortillas before, but never from scratch..Even my husband had a nice time. Not a fancy or Gourmet cooking class but for a good cause and at a great price

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

661501513.name: Great cooking class!
661501513.author: a TripAdvisor user
661501513.reviewBody: Amazing couple hours learning about the local food and culture. And of course eating my (slightly burnt) homemade quesadillas, salsa and pozol! Definitely worth it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

658522279.name: Storytelling with Amy
658522279.author: a TripAdvisor user
658522279.reviewBody: Go to the storytelling with Amy, especially after you do the free-walking tour in town. She elaborates on many cultural details and is a great story teller!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

658327400.name: Excellent Storytelling and Cultural Lesson
658327400.author: a TripAdvisor user
658327400.reviewBody: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed the 3pm storytelling session. Our guide talked us through the local customs, traditions and beliefs. Really interesting! Finished with telling us a couple of local stories and legends. Really excellent!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

656447016.name: Excellent cooking classes with Juan
656447016.author: a TripAdvisor user
656447016.reviewBody: We participated in the cooking workshop at 11 o\u2019clock. Our guide Juan teached us the way of doing Quesadillas, Mexican Salsa and also the drink made of corn. It was delicious and very interesting! Juan knew a lot of things about the way the people cook in the communities. We really enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it to everyone!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

654859518.name: GREAT worthwhile experience with STEPS
654859518.author: a TripAdvisor user
654859518.reviewBody: My 12-year-old-son and I recently did the 11am STEPS cooking class with Amy and loved it!  We made tortillas and quesadillas the traditional way and a drink called posol made out of corn.  Amy is very knowledgable about the culture and traditions of Chiapas and passionate about her work.  The fee for the cooking class was very reasonable with an option to give a donation to help raise money for a library in one of the small villages outside of San Cristobal.  The morning was fun and informative and I\'d highly recommend it if you are interested in learning more about the people and culture of this area of Mexico.  THANK YOU Amy for a great experience and for the work you are doing in the Chiapas area!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

654845529.name: Wonderful experience!
654845529.author: a TripAdvisor user
654845529.reviewBody: We felt in love with Amy\u2019s & friends place, ideas and activities they do:) we spend few days with them taking part in the cooking workshops, story telling events and some little trips we did together inside and around San Cristo. I reccomend to everybody to take part in their events cause its extremely interesting and has a beautiful cause! - supports children of local indian communities.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

654008415.name: Fascinating story experience and respect to the important work of this NGO
654008415.author: a TripAdvisor user
654008415.reviewBody: It was really interesting to hear Amy telling us about the stories and legends of the local cultures of Chiapas. She obviously has so much knowledge about the area and was really generous and answered all of our questions patiently. Apart from the story-telling she explained and simulated a local ceremony and explained about the religions and beliefs of the people of the region.\nHighly recommended, and I would even dare say a must visit! Muchas gracias and keep up the good work!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

651576756.name: Amazing Story Museum
651576756.author: a TripAdvisor user
651576756.reviewBody: A really great experience and project. I really appreciate their work and love. Congratulations!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

650777665.name: fun + yummie + interesting
650777665.author: a TripAdvisor user
650777665.reviewBody: You get more then you expect! I\u00b4ve been to the lunch and the dinner cooking class and I was very impressed about the love and passion that was put into this amazing project. You are not only at a cooking class but you learn a lot about the place and the indigenous culture - and by the way you support a very important work in the local community.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

650587483.name: Amazing experience!
650587483.author: a TripAdvisor user
650587483.reviewBody: Me and a friend went to the free storytelling at 3:00pm. We loved this experience. We learned so much and experienced a ceremony traditional. I plan on coming back for the free cooking class tomorrow at 11:00am! They are helping indigenous people with literacy and supporting their culture and traditions. It\u2019s magical!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

649694774.name: Super interesting and really fun night!!
649694774.author: a TripAdvisor user
649694774.reviewBody:
We did the cooking class with Amy at Steps in San Cristobal and it was amazing. 
We made tamales from scratch and a cocktail with the local spirit. Amy knows so much about the area, the indigenous populations and Mexico as a whole - could've asked questions and listened to her answers all night.

Would highly recommend this to anyone who goes to San Cristobal! Amazing price too!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

649691657.name: experience +
649691657.author: a TripAdvisor user
649691657.reviewBody: Steps is an impressive group. Not only do they support indigenous groups through education, but they also teach tourists a lot about the region. We participated in all their events and learned a lot. If we had been able to stay longer, we would have joined them in building a library! Great opportunities to be a part of something impressively holistically supportive.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

649287726.name: Steps in San cristobal
649287726.author: a TripAdvisor user
649287726.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the stories by Amy and in the evening we made delicious tamales. \nBuilding up a library for the poor schools of the surrounding native towns is simply wonderful!!\nAmy is an energetic person telling wonderful stories and putting lots of afford in her Projekt!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

647852327.name: A nice way to know a lot of chiapas
647852327.author: a TripAdvisor user
647852327.reviewBody: I found interesting facts about chiapanecan food, drinks and culture! Amy explained and teached us all about most popular and important things to do/from chiapas. Story time was great and amy spiced it up very nicely. We tried posh and tascalate drink and we had a cleanse ceremony, there is a lot of things to learn about. Also cooking class it\'s a nice way to learn about mexican most traditional food! Try on this experience! Highly recommended!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

647313577.name: Valuable and fun experience on mexican cuisine!
647313577.author: a TripAdvisor user
647313577.reviewBody: Very interesting and fun experience where you get to make your own traditional mexican dinner from the bottom alongside hearing stories and facts on the food and culture. I highly recommend it! We cooked and heard stories and had fun for more than two hours and the time just passed so quickly! And the food was delicious.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

646699285.name: So worth the experience
646699285.author: a TripAdvisor user
646699285.reviewBody: I went for a lunch cooking session and made cheese tortillas with salsa the traditional way. We were a group of three people and our instructor has been so fantastic. We were able to do every step of the way ourselves while getting great explainations and background on the lives of the indigenous people. The price you pay is solely for ingredients but I encourage you to donate. They are a NGO and will use the money to support the indigenous community.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

646582803.name: Amazing evening!
646582803.author: a TripAdvisor user
646582803.reviewBody: I highly recommend coming for the night cooking class! You get to make tamales and a warm fruit drink..AND you get to learn so much about the culture, what steps are being taken to improve education for children, and much more. Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

646214989.name: Fun cooking class, great people, and educational experience.
646214989.author: a TripAdvisor user
646214989.reviewBody: We made pozol, salsa, and tortillas (for quesadillas), while learning more about the culture, food, and history of the locals. Worth doing while in San Cristobal! Will definitely visit again.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

645923574.name: Great food for tummy and brain
645923574.author: a TripAdvisor user
645923574.reviewBody: We went there for the two cooking Workshops and both times it was a perfect combination of learning, great food and laughter! Definitely recommend if you\'re in town!! Amy is Soo nice and sooooo knowledgeable\nThank you :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

645413551.name: Captivating Program
645413551.author: a TripAdvisor user
645413551.reviewBody: I highly recommend a visit to this space for a fascinating and rich introduction to some of the stories, histories, and traditions of the area. The presenter was skillfully able to share an amazing wealth of information that helped deepen my experience of San Cristobal, from learning about the presence of Coca Cola in traditional rituals to hearing about the programs goals to preserve and share orally passed local myths.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

644630336.name: Very informative
644630336.author: a TripAdvisor user
644630336.reviewBody: We learned a lot and the \u201cstoryteller\u201c could answer all of our questions, she certainly knew a lot about the indigenous communities and the history of San Cristobal. I really recommend going there!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

640926219.name: Best Tamales of my life
640926219.author: a TripAdvisor user
640926219.reviewBody: In the cooking class we not only learned how to cook Tamales and Ponche, we also learned a lot about culture and traditions and were able to support the local communities\nThe most recomendable thing to do in San Cristobal!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

639043685.name: This is exactly how tourism should be like
639043685.author: a TripAdvisor user
639043685.reviewBody:
If you want to have a real and educational experience, come here and enjoy what tourism should really be about: learning, understanding, building bridges.

We had a fantastic evening that started with a private two hour class of indigenous culture and the fabulous project Steps is conducting in the region. We then went on to cook Tamales together, for basically only the costs of the food. 

Any further contribution is voluntary, an one can donate as much as they like. We donated everything we had in our pockets, because the work Steps does is awesome and we were glad we could add a small contribution to it.

If you want to talk to real people and get to know the country and region beyond the typical hostal chit chat, this is the perfect place for you. Bring warm clothes, because cooking is outside.

Thank you everyone, especially Montse, for this beautiful evening.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

638389518.name: Fun, informative and inexpensive cooking class!
638389518.author: a TripAdvisor user
638389518.reviewBody: I went to the morning cooking workshop at Steps and it was such an awesome experience! Not only did Any teach the class herself she told interesting stories about the local communities that they work with as well as her own stories of her travels. A fun, hands on experience which is super cheap. We ended up leaving a good tip as the experience was so worth it and I know the money will go towards good cause!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

638361323.name: Steps in San Cristobal de las Casas
638361323.author: a TripAdvisor user
638361323.reviewBody: We went for story hour and couldn\'t have spent our time better!  We learned so much about the history, local, regional, ethnic, plus some of the country, that it definitely helped us better understand all the we were experiencing and seeing.  I highly recommend visiting STEPS during your time in San Cristobal.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

637547278.name: Amy\u2019s cooking class
637547278.author: a TripAdvisor user
637547278.reviewBody: A truest wonderful way to experience Chiapas food and learn how to make it! Fun and very interactive. Great way to meet other travels as well. We learnt how to make tamales from scratch and about the Mayan history of the local area. Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

636852969.name: A must-do in San Cristobal
636852969.author: a TripAdvisor user
636852969.reviewBody: As our group did not speak Spanish, we found it a bit difficult to delve into the local culture during our trip to Mexico. In the few hours we spent at Steps - we have managed to learn more about local culture, traditions, history of Chiapas and Mexico on the whole than we did in the rest of our trip!\nAmy led our story time and it was honestly one of our the highlights of our entire trip. Extremely informative, charismatic, dedicated and interesting girl who set up Steps.\nI could not recommend this more!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

636594474.name: Super Cooking Class
636594474.author: a TripAdvisor user
636594474.reviewBody: Amy and Montse were amazing.  What a great time we had cooking pozol from scratch.  Then making quesadillas.  It was great to visit with Montse and learn about a lot of local food and history.  Amy was also a fount of information.  We wished we had been able to have an extra day to come for story time.  Although, after visiting with the two of them, we felt like we had an entirely delightful multi-cultural experience.  If you get a chance, go, either to the cooking class or storytime.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

634931026.name: Storytime
634931026.author: a TripAdvisor user
634931026.reviewBody: Thoroughly enjoyed this. Amy has a wealth of knowledge and is extremely passionate. She was chatting to a group of three of us for about an hour and a half. We tried a local drink and also some Posh. Happy to give a donation at the end as being put towards a good cause.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

633630600.name: Great cooking class
633630600.author: a TripAdvisor user
633630600.reviewBody: We had a very good time learning how to cook traditional mexican food and afterwards eating our delicious meal ;-) \nMeanwhile cooking we learned a lot about the indigenous people and the host were telling about their interesting ongoing projects.\nWe can definitely recommend this place to others and will be happy to come back! :-)

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

632954671.name: Great Free Walking Tour + Cooking Workshop
632954671.author: a TripAdvisor user
632954671.reviewBody: We participated in the Free Walking Tour in the Morning and in the evening in the cooking Workshop. The Free Walking Tour was interesting and the cooking night was really fun and we particularly enjoyed the Self made Cocktail ! Thank you guys ! \ud83d\udc98

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

631787050.name: Great!
631787050.author: a TripAdvisor user
631787050.reviewBody: Very interesting and informative, the guide had a wealth of knowledge about San Cristobal. Highly recommend

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

631073065.name: Tamales + Posh = what can go wrong??
631073065.author: a TripAdvisor user
631073065.reviewBody: Walking through San Cristobal I found a cooking workshop where they teach you how to make tamales, mmmm why not??, so I decided to live the experience, best decision ever! Was very interesting to learn how to make your own tamales from the very beginning and also very fun, thanks Amy! Thanks Steps! For sure I will come back for the Tortillas and Quesadillas workshop :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

630916838.name: Pleasant afternoon - highly recommend
630916838.author: a TripAdvisor user
630916838.reviewBody: We found a little flyer in our hotel advertising story time and cooking classes and decided to check it out with our 7 year old son. We went for 3 pm story time & because it was dia de muertos Amy had extra time to take us on a little walking tour as well. She is a lovely and enthusiastic guide with lots of great info to share, and I\u2019m so impressed with the activities of her organization, which works with kids and families, making story books of local tales and bringing them to the villages around San Cristobal. We had a really great time and learned a lot, and my son had fun too, but it is not really a children\u2019s thing as the name \u201cstory time\u201d might imply. The stories of the day were the kind meant to warn children of the dangers of the night - el sombreron, la llorona - and a few stories of suicides of star crossed lovers. Our son was fine with it but just to note if others are expecting something different! Amy also included a copal cleansing and offered some of her favorite pox, both of which were lovely and accompanied by great explanations. Thank you Amy for a great afternoon!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

630606117.name: Best Cooking Class Ever!
630606117.author: a TripAdvisor user
630606117.reviewBody: You will not regret taking this cooking class. Amy is the best! She makes you feel super welcome and treats you like family. We had so much fun making traditional Mexican meals and drinks! Very worth it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

629534034.name: Incredible experience and woman!
629534034.author: a TripAdvisor user
629534034.reviewBody: Amy is so knowledgeable about the area and shares hey passion so well. It\'s amazing to learn so much about the communities around San Cristobal. The cooking class was also well worth it! Talks at 3 for English and 5 for Spanish

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

625347550.name: Unique experience
625347550.author: a TripAdvisor user
625347550.reviewBody: We really had an awesome time at STEPS. You could feel the love and passion for the Mayan\u2019s traditions and the Mexican culture by the organization. We really got a lot of information. The organization supports the local children and our voluntary donation is for a good cause (a library). We would definitely recommend a visit!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

623054313.name: Good to go before exploring the town
623054313.author: a TripAdvisor user
623054313.reviewBody: Went to their Story Time program. They can tell you interesting stories about the Mayan culture and people around San Cristobal. You can go there in your first day here to have basic knowledge and that will help you when you go explore and experience it yourself. Besides, you can help the children in the communities by your donation.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

620031170.name: A pretty nice place to learn other cultures
620031170.author: a TripAdvisor user
620031170.reviewBody: A beautiful way to rethink through the original cultures of Mexico with various workshops. Do not miss it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

619163515.name: A great cultural experience
619163515.author: a TripAdvisor user
619163515.reviewBody: After checking out Story Time and leaving with the knowledge of the legends, cultural drinks and experiencing their fire ceremony I had to check out the cooking class. Both classes gave me a lot more than I expected and knowing you\'ve contributed to a good cause it is a double win for the day. You should definitely check them out.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

618901001.name: A must do in San Cristobal
618901001.author: a TripAdvisor user
618901001.reviewBody: Many people that come and visit san Cristobal always wonder about the indiginuos culture, this place is highly recommended to learn about their culture and tradition also to learn to cook the way they do!The lady In charge  of this place is so friendly and sweet! It makes you to feel welcome \ud83d\ude01 I will totally visit again!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

618250569.name: Making the local food and experiencing the traditional event
618250569.author: a TripAdvisor user
618250569.reviewBody:
It's very worth to attend this event in San Cristobal de las Casas .
You can try to make the tortilla from the kernel of corn to the tortilla chips all the ingredients you can make by yourself .
The host is very kind and friendly she will told you everything that you wanna know in  San Cristobal de las Casas .
There are three kind of workshop here,making the tortilla(11 A.M) , the story time(traditional Maya ceremony that you can experience), Tamale and something local drinks that you can make by yourself as well in the night time(7 P.M). 
If you have the whole day time you can try the three kind of the event here .
在這裡你可以體驗三種活動從早上的製作玉米餅下午的故事時間(可以體驗當地瑪雅祭祀儀式)到晚上的墨西哥粽子製作,如果你有整天的時間可以三個都參加。此外主人也非常友善他會跟你介紹在這邊許多好玩的地方好吃的道地食物，價格也很親民。

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

618248503.name: Must to do this in San Crist\u00f3bal highly recommend!!
618248503.author: a TripAdvisor user
618248503.reviewBody: It\u2019s amazing experience to join this workshop. You can learn lots of Mayan culture, how these local people make Taller de cocina and local drink! The handmade style is totally taste different. You will know what you eat and truly, taste very good. We have lots of fun and we do enjoy the cooking process. If you try to find something to do, don\u2019t miss here! This is a very worthwhile event.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

617011815.name: An serious issue people should pay attention to
617011815.author: a TripAdvisor user
617011815.reviewBody: This is not just normal foundation, this actually means a lot more than we can imagine. They are helping a culture to be protected and past from generation to generation .

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

616618504.name: Impressive life and culture
616618504.author: a TripAdvisor user
616618504.reviewBody: It is an interesting way to learn traditional and different culture! \u201cStep in San cristobal\u201d prepare for everything with heart to cultivate the relationship between people, culture and history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

605445702.name: Such a fun afternoon !
605445702.author: a TripAdvisor user
605445702.reviewBody: we had so much fun at the cooking class making quesadillas from scratch and then eating so many you can\'t move ! It was so intersting to learn all about the cooking techniques as well as facts you would never know about san cristobal. Set in a beautiful courtyard under the sun you can\'t go wrong. Thank you!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

604440853.name: Best thing to do in San Cristobal de las Casas
604440853.author: a TripAdvisor user
604440853.reviewBody: I read about the cooking class in cafe while on the walking tour so decided I would see what it was like. When I arrived I was so warmly greeted by Amy and Juan and they explained that we would make quesadillas from scratch! It was so much fun. I then came along to the story-telling event the following day which was really fun and really educational. I would recommend to all groups but as a solo traveller, I found it particularly nice as a way to socialise and while learning about such an interesting culture.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

603695147.name: Magic and creatin real community!
603695147.author: a TripAdvisor user
603695147.reviewBody: This place is magic!! i lived an amazing experience listening the leyends and stories of mexican culture!! \nall of the team are kind and commited !

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

597436219.name: A great way to gain insight into indigenous culture in the middle of San Crist\u00f3bal de Las Casas
597436219.author: a TripAdvisor user
597436219.reviewBody: I visited Steps for the storytime, which is a great way to gain insight in different elements of the indigenous cultures of the region. The legend tour is very interesting and besides one particular typical legend, it includes a lot of background information on the place the legend is from, a great way to learn about different places and their cultural specificities, and at the same time support a great project aimed at preserving important elements of indigenous culture in the younger generations. As an extra, you even get to try the typical beverages. :) What is also great is that the tour is offered daily in English and in Spanish. I highly recommend it. :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

591485736.name: cool to do in rain. interesting, fun, nice experience and full of knowledge
591485736.author: a TripAdvisor user
591485736.reviewBody: i went there for the storytime which was so cool! get to know a lot about chiapas, indigenous, culture, tradition and mayan legends.\nwhen you enter for the event, they clean your energy with copal, a traditional medicine they used in the ceremony. besides the storytime to listen lots of stories and legends about different cummunities, you also get a local drink, a pox, and a storybook they made. i do admire this charity organization and what they are doing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

590742193.name: The real and fantasy in one story!
590742193.author: a TripAdvisor user
590742193.reviewBody: I met Amy at La Ensenanza, right in her cosy room filled with stories which combine the mystical with the real. I went there because I wanted to do something more than just another site-seeing activity. Amy offered an experience which awakens the senses whilst recounting stories which are sown into the traditions of communities in Chiapas. I was greeted in such a personal intimate approach and loved the flavorsome red blend known as tascalate! I highly recommend a visit to this fantastic project and to support such a creative initiative!

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

393703253.name: Great tour, great guide
393703253.author: a TripAdvisor user
393703253.reviewBody: Nice tour in the historic center,  best thing to do on your first day here. The guide gives good tips for your stay.

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

381931265.name: Get to know more of it
381931265.author: a TripAdvisor user
381931265.reviewBody: It was a very nice walk where I learned a lot... I got to know some spots in town that I didn\'t notice before and history about the city.\nIt doesn\'t take long and it is totaly woth it.\nIt is also very nice to support a project that helps the community (students, children, etc.)

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

381480890.name: the best free walking tour
381480890.author: a TripAdvisor user
381480890.reviewBody:
the free walking tour is everyday at 15:00 from central park in english and spanish.
the guide is the one with red umbrella. 
i did the tour with the lovely tour guide Fabi. she gave us the most interesting tour, with all the legends, histories, stories, where to eat, what to do, where to drink and where to dance, and all the funny traditions here. chiapas and san cristobal are really so amazing!!!
and this free walking tour is a social project for helping scholarship and supporting other projects as well. with some tips, you can enjoy everything of san cristobal and doing something good at the same time. i feel so involved here now=D

address.streetAddress: Calle Ejercito Nacional # 19A

663489158.name: Teen and toddler
663489158.author: a TripAdvisor user
663489158.reviewBody:
If you are staying several days at San Cristobal maybe it’s worth it. It 80 stairs but you can also get in car at the top. The Church is nothing breathtaking (that’s way I am taking a star). The view is lovely but around the Church from the outside. The stairs smell like pee, no benches available while going up, they have been vandalized. (Taking another star for that)
Fee: free
Stairs: 80
Parking: free
I don’t think is a must do. 
No stroller friendly

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

639293309.name: Well worth the walk
639293309.author: a TripAdvisor user
639293309.reviewBody: The small walk has a large payoff when viewing the suburbs of San Cristobal at a decent height. It is a wonderful view behind the church of the town and its nearby mountains and  its sprawling agricultural land.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

619842172.name: Lazy
619842172.author: a TripAdvisor user
619842172.reviewBody: I really wanted to see the view from this church, but was feeling too lazy to walk up the seemingly endless stairway, so I took a taxi. The view of the town below was lovely. The church was empty. I did walk down.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

597184569.name: Church on the hill
597184569.author: a TripAdvisor user
597184569.reviewBody: When walking the pedestrian of San Crist\u00f3bal you can\u2019t avoid seeing this Catholic Church on top of the hill. The walk uphill is not long/hard and if you look carefully through the threes surrounding the church you have a good view of the city. \n\nThe church itself is small but nice ... but not really spectacular.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

560303358.name: Worth The Walk from Zocalo
560303358.author: a TripAdvisor user
560303358.reviewBody: It is an amazing view of San Cristobal, definitely worth walking up those funky steps. The top and middle of the steps are worth a picture.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

559921464.name: A must see !
559921464.author: a TripAdvisor user
559921464.reviewBody:
I really liked the view, the steps are very pretty and I loved the yellow tones. 

San Cristobal is charming! Every street has a unique blend.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

556878593.name: Not really worth the effort
556878593.author: a TripAdvisor user
556878593.reviewBody:
As someone said already not much to see from the top of the hill. Many trees prevent the view over San Cristóbal.
The steps were constructed in 1941 as an inscription on one of the steps says.

The church is closed because of the damages caused by the earthquakes in September 2017.
But climbing the stairs one is able to see how ordinary people live in sheds (on the left hand side), they probably work as cleaning personnel in one of the numerous hotels charging 100 USD per night ...  
Interesting is a satellite antenna on one of the roofs ...

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

515466318.name: If you have time but not essential
515466318.author: a TripAdvisor user
515466318.reviewBody: Climbing up the steps to the church definitely burns a few calories and is a nice addition if you have the time. We climbed it at 6.30pm in the evening and when we reached the top we were able to watch a Quincinera (?) ceremony (when a girl turns 15). It was a nice insight into Latin American culture.\nIt\'s a nice walk and look out point of the whole city so if you have the time why not?

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

465107161.name: worth the effort
465107161.author: a TripAdvisor user
465107161.reviewBody: A few flights of stairs to climb, but worth the effort.  Nice view of the city and Iglesia de Guadalupe at the other end of town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

452945913.name: The view is blocked by Trees
452945913.author: a TripAdvisor user
452945913.reviewBody: we walked to the top only to find most of the view is blocked by Trees.  It was a easy climb up so wasn\'t that bad but dont expect amazing views,

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

448968762.name: Yup, another church in Mexico.
448968762.author: a TripAdvisor user
448968762.reviewBody: The church sits atop the hill over looking the city and is well photographed.  The short step stairs will give you a nice little view of the San Cristobal and the church it\'s self is typical.  Worth the walk and if you like churches and a nice view.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

446620839.name: Okay
446620839.author: a TripAdvisor user
446620839.reviewBody: Nice to get above the city to see it, but the views are limited and there are better places in the town that give better views with less hassle.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

444982136.name: Great views and interesting church
444982136.author: a TripAdvisor user
444982136.reviewBody: A short but steep hike to this church gives you two benefits. The church itself is typical Spanish Catholic - full of statues, stained glass  and saints festooned with  offerings for favours received.  The building itself is modest and small. The second benefit is the view from the church down to the city itself and that on a sunny day is worth the hike just by itself.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

441936785.name: hike up the hill
441936785.author: a TripAdvisor user
441936785.reviewBody: didn\'t count the steps, but it was worth the effort to scale the hill and get the view of the city laid out below.  sunset is the best time- the colors are amazing- and then head for cocktail hour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

408672456.name: Some nice views of San Cristobal
408672456.author: a TripAdvisor user
408672456.reviewBody: The mirador gives you some nice views from San Cristobal and the surrounding area. It\'s worth the 15-minute walk from the main square.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

389835244.name: Nice view...
389835244.author: a TripAdvisor user
389835244.reviewBody: Not much to see, it\'s great for pictures, ask for directions.\nThe surroundings seem a little unsafe.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

378774080.name: View
378774080.author: a TripAdvisor user
378774080.reviewBody: Night view overlooking the city lights. Like many Catholic Churches, but ribbons, Cheflon drapery, other Indigineous articles included

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

378065900.name: great view
378065900.author: a TripAdvisor user
378065900.reviewBody: You can see San Cristobal from the top and make some exercise with the stairs that guide you to the church. Back from the church you can see fields and nature.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

377604407.name: small scam on the way up
377604407.author: a TripAdvisor user
377604407.reviewBody: There are always a couple of boys wanting you to sign a small note book with your name and then give them a donation for the school. It is a scam. don\'t do it..

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

374356582.name: Jog the stairs in the morning :)
374356582.author: a TripAdvisor user
374356582.reviewBody: Right beside Hotel Casa de Guadalupe, wonderful little gathering area below stairs and walking distance to the core of downtown

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

372868579.name: Great views
372868579.author: a TripAdvisor user
372868579.reviewBody: Great view over both sides of San Cristobal - over the city and from the back of the church over the countryside.  It is a steep climb up the stairs to the church but you are rewarded when you see the city before you.  Look inside the small church when you get to the top as well.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

366941818.name: Nice view
366941818.author: a TripAdvisor user
366941818.reviewBody: If you want a good view in San Cristobal de las Casas this could be a nice alternative but you have to deserve it since you have to climb a lot of steps ! It\'s clearly worth it though !

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

356373599.name: Great place to get a panoramic view of the city
356373599.author: a TripAdvisor user
356373599.reviewBody: Located at one end of the city with a small park at its base this small church perched atop a hill is great for taking sweeping panoramic shots of San Cristobal while surveying the overall layout of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

351839565.name: worth the climb
351839565.author: a TripAdvisor user
351839565.reviewBody: well worth the climb for the views of the town, actually more photogenic a little way from the top to avoid trees

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

347651071.name: Not that good
347651071.author: a TripAdvisor user
347651071.reviewBody: The place stinks! Its really dirty, plus the best view its at the beginning or half way the walk. At the top the view is ruined by the telephone and lighting cables

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

346001257.name: A nice walk for a nice view
346001257.author: a TripAdvisor user
346001257.reviewBody: This is a nice walk to digest after a good meal, and you are rewarded with a nice view of the city from a good vantage point. We went around dusk so we could see the change of light, and were very happy we went. Of course at the same time you get to see other caf\u00e9s, shops, bars and restaurants which are often missed as they aren\'t in the centre of town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

344762258.name: Spectacular Church
344762258.author: a TripAdvisor user
344762258.reviewBody: The Church is quite a good uphill walk from the centre but well worth the effort. Very well kept up with extremely colourful religious statues and a wonderful view of the surrounding area.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

344597686.name: Nice climb with great views and a good cause
344597686.author: a TripAdvisor user
344597686.reviewBody: This was a nice workout with a reward - a city view! \nIf you happen to meet a group of guys at the top of the cathedral asking for money for an orphanage,they are not fake. They collect money for around 25 children. Some of those kids are orphans as their parents got killed, and others only have their Mom who can not provide enough food because she has several children at home, so the kids stay with these guys and some ladies who take care of them. It\'s a good cause!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

343850604.name: Walk or Run these Stairs with the Locals
343850604.author: a TripAdvisor user
343850604.reviewBody: My daughter and I often walk/run the steps leading up to the church, and we see locals doing the same. It\'s a great work-out with plenty of benches for taking a break. Need water? Sometimes there\'s a family selling water and other snacks at the top, there\'s a tienda in the middle and another across the street from the bottom of the steps. It\'s 281 steps to the top (Yes, we counted.) At the top, be sure to walk around the church. We often see many workmen on break (rarely is someone actually working - seriously). There\'s a gazebo and another flag monument. One can also run to and from the top of the church using the local road that winds up the hill. My husband had done this, but he doesn\'t recommend that a woman do it alone. There are simply too many side roads and it\'s not busy enough. \n\nNote: Some of the pictures of the stairs leading to the church are actually of Templo de Guadalupe. This attraction is off Calle Allende, not Real de Guadalupe.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

317886712.name: Unbeatable views of the city
317886712.author: a TripAdvisor user
317886712.reviewBody: Panoramic view of the entire city/valley. A number of interesting celebrations and festivals there during the year. Pretty decorations at Christmas.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

316940417.name: A Must-Do
316940417.author: a TripAdvisor user
316940417.reviewBody: Go halfway up and stop for pics and a rest on the benches, then head on back down. Definitely one of our favorite moments in town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

265159854.name: One of the greatest views of San Cristobal
265159854.author: a TripAdvisor user
265159854.reviewBody: Even though at the top of these about 200 stairs there is a nice and tiny church, the view of San Cristobal and the surrounding mountains is worth to see, especially at sunset.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

262166098.name: Worth a climb
262166098.author: a TripAdvisor user
262166098.reviewBody: It takes longer to get up then you expect. Its a nice view, though not a 360 degree view as you would expect from such a perfect vantage point. It would be a great place to have a lunchtime picnic + a little exercise

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

261025537.name: Beautiful Mirador
261025537.author: a TripAdvisor user
261025537.reviewBody: Going up the stairs is harder than it looks but it is well worth it. There are nice views from the top and the church is beautiful too. Apparently in December there are large fiestas here, but we were not in town then.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

259502013.name: NICE!
259502013.author: a TripAdvisor user
259502013.reviewBody: It seemed like an easy walking going up the stairs, but once we were halfway my wife and I were tired out...lol The combination of the altitude and stairs took its toll on us, but halfway their are some benches to sit on. Once we were on top the view was beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

258274157.name: Nice for a walk or jog to one end of town. Great views.
258274157.author: a TripAdvisor user
258274157.reviewBody: Went for a jog around SC and climbed up the steps here for a view of SC. Well worth it, and slightly different to the busier part of town. Worth the walk/jog over.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

256758392.name: Nice Church
256758392.author: a TripAdvisor user
256758392.reviewBody: As I caught my breath after walking up all of those stairs I was impressed with the view of beautiful San Cristobal and then thought about the man power that must have been involved in building this lovely church on a hill.  Lots too look at inside. A must do!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

246481956.name: Nice view
246481956.author: a TripAdvisor user
246481956.reviewBody: The church is not that pretty but the when you get to the top of the stairs worth the visit, specially if you getthere by 5 pm or around the time the sun is going down behind the mountains. You can take good pictures either from the bottom, top or atany point while you are going upstairs.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

237348967.name: OK
237348967.author: a TripAdvisor user
237348967.reviewBody: If you walk there, be prepared to take a lot of stairs and not see a whole lot once you\'re there, since the threes are really tall and block any view, the church has it\'s charm, but you can totally drive up there instead.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

139927262.name: A great place to rest
139927262.author: a TripAdvisor user
139927262.reviewBody: This place is mainly a school, but also hosts a great and simple cafe.  It is high enough above the city ot have a great view, yet easy enough to reach going up the stairs on "el cerro".  There is even an outside terrace that makes a great place to enjoy some coffee if it is not raining...\nI did take spanish courses here, and would also recommend them for that!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

135580751.name: Great Views, Good Coffee
135580751.author: a TripAdvisor user
135580751.reviewBody:
This restaurant is about a third of the way up the steps to San Cristobal Church on the hill not far from the zocalo. It's a great place to take a break on the way up or down the hill, with wonderful views over the city.
There's a large telescope inside the restaurant for guests to use.
The coffee is great, and a variety of sandwiches and other food are served.
The building also houses a school.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

128563700.name: Pretty views
128563700.author: a TripAdvisor user
128563700.reviewBody: It\'s a nice little walk up the stairs to this mirador, where you can get an excellent view of the city!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hermanos Dominguez 25-A Gradas a Sancristobalito, Centro

625541262.name: Most beautiful place I\u2018ve ever visited
625541262.author: a TripAdvisor user
625541262.reviewBody: What an experience. It\u2018s the most beautiful place I\u2018ve been on my travels in Mexiko. It\u2018s really hard to get there from San Cristobal around 12 hours travel but it\u2018s DEFINITLY worth it. First you go to Comitan (2 hours and 90 Pesos), take a taxi to the collectivos to Las Margaritas (5 minutes and 35 Pesos) . From Las Margeritas (to Las Margeritas it\u2019s 20 minutes and around 18 pesos) you just ask for the collectivos to Emiliano Zapata (5 hours and 105 Pesos). Than you have to walk around 2 hours and you are in heaven. I can recommend to do the walk in the afternoon or in the morning, otherwise it will be very hard. There is drinking water so you don\u2018t need to bring this with you. A fire is always burning and the men who work there are really nice. (There are always 2 around). You can cook there on the fireplace. Bring anti insect spray, flashlight and rubbish bags for sure. The walk is fun because you never know how it will be. My tip: bring rubber boots, than you are very safe of the mud. I would recommend 1 full day to get there and 3 full days there and 1 for the travel back. It\u2018s the paradise on earth but you have to like the nature. There are a lot of animals and thousands of insects. In the night you hear frogs and monkeys, sometimes very noisy.

585418614.name: Heaven in Chiapas!
585418614.author: a TripAdvisor user
585418614.reviewBody: Do you guys remember that, in order to go to heaven, you do have to go through the purgatory? Well, this is a pretty good analogy to Miramar. In order to get to the actual lagoon, you have to walk for about 2-4hrs (depending on the mud and weather). It\'s not possible to arrive by any other means: no cars, no horses: just plain old fashioned walking. When you do finally get there, you can expect an extraordinary view in an almost virgin place. No places to buy food or drinks (so, you must bring them with you). Camping equipment can be rented and boat tours are avaliable. The nights are amazing, and you will be enchanted by the magical sounds of monkeys. Go with friends, this is not a place to go alone with. And DO listen to the local guides or you will be lost in the jungle.

464274275.name: Hermoso!  Beautiful but limited activities and limited time on the tour.
464274275.author: a TripAdvisor user
464274275.reviewBody: Undeniably Miramar is beautiful and its water is crystal clear.  But really there is not much to do.  We took a tour to the 3 islands.  The guide took us at 8 AM and I was still in my jacket.  And then he said you can swim here!!!! He rushed us so he could finish his work as early as possible.  When we got back to the camping ground, the sun just came out!  So we asked if we could rent the kayak to go back to the islands.  They said we could not go there without a guide and if you want to go with a guide again, it would cost 400 pesos all over again!  So basically, we were just so bored there.  The most beautiful place is the islands but we could not enjoy it at all.  The caba\u00f1a was dirty.  At least they could have said that they could clean it for us before we got in.

359871267.name: Very hard to get there and have occurate information
359871267.author: a TripAdvisor user
359871267.reviewBody: This is a very beautiful laguna and place to stay (renting a hammoc or a tent, there are no bungalow or anything, only in the village of Emiliano Zapata where you start the 3km walk to the laguna). The problem is... to get there. We took a truck from Ocosingo, which took more than 6 hours, in the hard hard sun on the back and without any protection, I almost passed out ! They have a canvas cover but didn\'t use it, probably so that you can fit more people on the back of the truck without it... People hop on and off from the villages, with their stuff, it\'s not comfortable. I couldn\'t bear that journey again on the way back so we took a colectivo (minibus) to Comitan instead. You\'re at least protected from the very hard sun, but the "road" is very very bad also. It takes more than 5 hours. Also the service is not very good at the village, where you pay the entrance fee and rent what you need for your stay. They were incapable of telling us when the buses were leaving, they had different opinions and finally some people lost the 12 o\'clock bus (actually, it just didn\'t come) and had to wait for the hypothetical next one until 3 in the morning. Also, they can\'t book the truck back to Ocosingo for you so they just recomend that you go very early to catch it, but if there\'s no space it\'s too bad for you... and you can wait a few hours on the sun for the next one - if ever it comes, nothing\'s sure ! They could manage that better!

334192413.name: Secluded lake at the border of Lacandon jungle
334192413.author: a TripAdvisor user
334192413.reviewBody: I would like to provide more detailed information about this natural wonder. We travelled to Miramar from Comit\u00e1n, where we stayed overnight. We visited El Chiflon that day, which I also recommend. First you need to get collectivo from Comitan to Las Margaritas which was around 20 pesos per person. From where you have to take collectivo to Emiliano Zapata. Try to arrive to Las Margaritas early, because the journey  takes around 5 hours. Also talk to the drive to take you to centro turistico in Emiliano Zapata, because most collectivos end up in nearby village of San Quintin The road was asphalted from the beginning turning into a really rugged road later.
